Our Company Lancer Worldwide, a Hoshizaki Company, is an award-winning global leader in beverage dispensing. Through innovation and a commitment to dedication in action, we create products that benefit our customers worldwide, and give them a distinct advantage in the marketplace. We offer our teammates the opportunity to grow personally and professionally, to contribute to the success of a dynamic organization, and to serve others in a manner that exceeds their expectations. We welcome talented, passionate, and highly motivated individuals to join our team.
 Summary The AX Business Analyst is the primary lead collecting, structuring, analyzing, and reporting on operational business processes and data. The AX Analyst will be a vital part of the D365 implementation team to streamline all critical business processes by providing advanced process analysis, knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics 365 and supporting applications, formulating business requirements and conducting business use cases. The AX Business Analyst will design and implement solutions that address business challenges in the areas of Finance, Production, Procurement/Supply Chain and Materials.


  Essential Functions

Translate business requirements into functional and technical design documentation
Gather and document as-is and to-be processes and requirements
Perform gap analysis and recommend solutions
Coordinate and conduct QA and UAT (User Acceptance Testing) Testing
Assist to create initial training documentation
Performs other duties as required




  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Ability to multitask and manage several ERP efforts
Ability to perform descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics
Prior experience working with ERP systems required
Prior experience using MS SQL and SSRS report writing preffered
Prior experience with D365 implementations highly preferred
Ability to effortlessly maneuver through MS Applications, including Power Apps, Sharepoint, Teams and Azure
Bilingual in Spanish is highly desired




  Education and Experience 

Bachelor's Degree preferred
5 years minimum experience in an ERP Business Analyst role, Microsoft D365 preferred

The Alliance is seeking a Business Intelligence & Microsoft 365 Specialist to manage and optimize our SharePoint and OneDrive environments, supporting various Microsoft applications, and developing insightful dashboards and reports using Power BI. You will play a key role in ensuring the efficient and effective use of these tools to support our business processes, decision-making, users, and training functions.
Who We Are
At The Alliance, our mission is helping employers self-fund smart. We serve as the voice for self-funded employers who want more control over their healthcare costs and who believe that affordable, high-quality care should be accessible to everyone.
Why Work at The Alliance?
Along with the satisfaction you’ll receive from working with a mission-driven organization, you’ll join a humble, lively, and hard-working group of people. The Alliance is home to a highly collaborative, creative, and dedicated bunch; you’ll feel our warm friendliness, be fueled by our inspiring passion, and find support from us when you need it, too.
How You Will Contribute
Power BI Development

Design, develop, and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights.
Connect to various data sources, model data, and create interactive visualizations.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and timeliness in reporting.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand reporting requirements and deliver solutions that meet business needs.

SharePoint & OneDrive Management

Maintain SharePoint infrastructure and build out framework for internal audience.
Configure site settings, permissions, and workflows to ensure smooth operation and security.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to SharePoint functionality and performance.
Develop and implement strategies for content management and collaboration using SharePoint.
Assist users with OneDrive, file synchronization issues, and troubleshooting.
Monitor and manage storage quotas and data integrity.

Microsoft Applications Training & Tech Support

Provide support for various Microsoft applications (e.g., Office 365, Teams, Outlook).
Train users in Microsoft applications.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues for users related to Microsoft applications.

User Training and Support

Provide training and support to users on SharePoint, OneDrive, Power BI, and Microsoft stack.
Create and maintain user guides, documentation, and best practice resources.

Continuous Improvement

Stay current with the latest features and updates in SharePoint, OneDrive, Power BI, and Microsoft stack.
Recommend and implement improvements to enhance system performance and user experience.
Participate in project planning and execution related to SharePoint, OneDrive, and Power BI initiatives.

Your Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience managing SharePoint and OneDrive environments, supporting Microsoft applications, and developing reports and dashboards with Power BI.
Proficiency in SharePoint Online.
Strong knowledge of OneDrive for Business and Office 365 applications.
Advanced skills in Power BI, including data modeling, and Power Query.
Familiarity with Microsoft Teams and other collaboration tools.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Willingness to stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends.

Stand-Out From the Crowd Qualifications

Relevant certifications (e.g., Microsoft Certified: SharePoint Administrator, Power BI) are a plus.

ABOUT SOTHEBY'S
Established in 1744, Sotheby's is the world's premier destination for art and luxury. Sotheby's promotes access to and ownership of exceptional art and luxury objects through auctions and buy-now channels including private sales, e-commerce and retail. Our trusted global marketplace is supported by an industry-leading technology platform and a network of specialists spanning 40 countries and 70 categories which include Contemporary Art, Modern and Impressionist Art, Old Masters, Chinese Works of Art, Jewelry, Watches, Wine and Spirits, and Design, as well as collectible cars and real estate. Sotheby's believes in the transformative power of art and culture and is committed to making our industries more inclusive, sustainable and collaborative.

 THE ROLE
This role exists to develop insightful analysis and communicate findings in a clear and compelling way to drive the acquisition and retention of Sotheby's customers. The successful candidate will use their technical skills to analyze customer and transactional data, find opportunities to segment and personalize, and to test the effectiveness of these opportunities for global roll out.
The CRM Analytics Manager will be the go-to reporting and analytics partner for the customer data within the Growth Marketing team. You will be responsible for and own a diverse set of reporting, health, and analytics needs across email, CRM, the CDP, and all components of customer marketing data. You will be responsible for understanding campaign performance, customer segmentation, customer engagement and growth by analyzing, measuring, and recommending actionable solutions. You must be comfortable with SQL and pulling and cleansing raw data in order to perform your analysis. Responsibilities will incorporate KPI reporting, a/b testing design and analysis, customer segmentation, lift modeling, data modeling, dash boarding, and tooling - to discover strategic insights and guide decision making.
 Responsibilities:

Develop and execute a comprehensive email health and analytics model and strategy that aligns with overall marketing objectives and business goals
Work closely with our Email Service Provider (ESP), and our internal customer experience & data team to ensure the availability, quality, and accessibility of data required for email reporting and analytics
Extract actionable insights from complex email data sets
Drive A/B and multivariate testing initiatives to optimize email content, subject lines, send times, and other key elements and implement advanced testing methodologies
Collaborate with the marketing team to develop sophisticated, targeted email lists based on customer behavior, customer segments, demographics, and preferences
Implement advanced segmentation strategies
Provide senior Marketing leadership and other key stakeholders with reporting and insights
Proactively identify trends and business opportunities by bringing insight through detailed reporting and analysis which will allow for informed strategy and business development
Build customer views to understand the impact of Marketing on customers across all stages of the buying lifecycle including New User Acquisition, Engagement/Retention, and Reactivation and the role of each marketing channel throughout the customer journey
Building & maintaining strong working relationships across departments or teams based on trust and mutual respect
Communicating technical material with clear data visualization and compelling narrative to a range of audiences to provide insight into the factors impacting business performance
You can collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in business, finance, accounting, statistics, or related field and 4 years' experience in data analytics or related field
Proficient at navigating cross functional efforts and influencing Product, Finance, Business Operations and Engineering
A balance of analytical skills as well as strong organization and communication skills is key
Deep knowledge of email marketing, database marketing, data integration, and CRM
Polished communication skills with ability to clearly convey complex data and information across a broad landscape of clientele
Strong working knowledge of Marketing Mix Models, Multi-Touch Attribution Models, Customer Segmentation and incrementality measurement approaches
Advanced Microsoft PowerPoint abilities. Adept at creating visually appealing and insightful slide decks to effectively communicate complex concepts and analytical findings
You have a passion for working in a fast-paced agile environment
Expert at BI Tools (e.g. Tableau), SQL and Excel - ability to manipulate large quantities of data to drive business decisions is a must
Strong organizational skills, a strong sense of ownership and accountability, and the ability to lead projects, communicate effectively, and be a self-starter
Experience using an enterprise-level digital analytics platforms (e.g. Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, etc.)
Strong problem solving, analytical and quantitative skills and ability to synthesize findings into tangible actions that help drive business outcomes
Strong organizational skills with a demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities and lead complex projects with a high degree of ambiguity
Ability to work onsite 2-3 days per week
Sponsorship is not available for this role

The proposed base salary for this position ranges from $130,000-$150,000. In addition to base salary successful candidates are eligible to receive a discretionary bonus, as well as a competitive benefits package. Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors including relevant skills, training, experience, education, and, where applicable, licensure or certifications obtained. Market and organizational factors are also considered.

 Overview: 
 
 Career opportunities abound at Sound!


  Sound Behavioral Health is growing and we are hiring a revenue cycle analyst in Tukwila, WA! Sound is one of King County’s most comprehensive providers of quality mental health and addiction treatment services, supporting our area’s most vulnerable populations. A central tenet of our work is Reaching Recovery, an evidence-based clinical care model.
 


 Sound offers a stimulating and supportive working environment, and opportunities for professional growth, in a strengths-based organization. We believe in and advocate for Diversity, Equity, Justice, and Inclusion for our team and clients.
 


 The Revenue Cycle Analyst reports to the Revenue Cycle Director and supports the Revenue Cycle Team. This position’s contributions include production of various reports from multiple systems and data sources to assist in identifying trends, enhancing visibility, and developing automation for the Revenue Cycle department. Report creation, data analysis, workflow automation and data visualization are key functions of this role.
  Responsibilities: 
 ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES
 Data Management and Reporting 

Analyzes claim data and presents reporting that demonstrates trends, deficiencies or areas for improvement in the revenue cycle.
Designs and implements automated workflows and reports based on the needs of the department and agency.
Builds dashboards to help visualize data that guides leadership decisions.
Develops reporting that highlights potential payer relations concerns and informs contracting negotiations.
Builds reports within the Electronic Health Record (EHR) system and builds Revenue Cycle specific reports within Tableau.
Attends cross departmental meetings and engages in projects related to revenue cycle improvement or impact.
Works closely with external Revenue Cycle Management team to ensure all new billing regulations and guidance are reflected in the billing system accurately and timely.
Develops reports for management teams, financial teams and clinical teams related to revenue cycle.
Extracts and analyzes data from multiple data sources.
Compiles, audits, provides correction support, and prepares multiple reports used to support various contractual billings and invoices.
Support and maintenance of the billing system within the EHR.
Reviews, updates and maintains the billing tables and set-up requirements related to service codes, fee structure and liability distribution in the billing system.


 Data Review and Error Resolution



Reviews and interprets data and suggests ways in which reporting could be streamlined or automated.
Provides assistance/support related to data issues.




 Processes, Documentation and Training

Learns about and stays abreast of requirements, procedures, etc., to ensure Sound meets requirements for data reporting and accurate billing.
Works with the Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) team to ensure data collection and reporting needs are met and are in compliance.



 SUPPLEMENTAL FUNCTIONS


Completes assigned special projects independently or as a contributor to, or lead of, a project team.
Performs other duties as assigned.

 KEY WORK RELATIONSHIPS

Establishes and maintains positive, ethical, and professional working relationships with Finance team, including RCM, Business Applications team, clinicians, Sound management and team members, clients, vendors, and other professionals.
 Qualifications: 
 
 EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE


Bachelor’s degree in related field required or five (5) years of related experience in lieu of degree.
Minimum of one (1) year of experience in report creation, data analysis, data management, and relational database structure and management,
Experience working as an analyst in a healthcare setting is required.
Experience with SQL and Crystal Reports required.
Some experience with Business Intelligence tools (ex. Domo, Tableau) preferred.

 KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

Knowledge and experience in a healthcare revenue cycle setting with a basic understanding of billing and coding for services.
Knowledge and experience with Microsoft SQL Server and Management tools.
Knowledge in report creation, Crystal reports, and SQL interfaces such as WinSQL.
Strong knowledge of data and security concepts as they apply to HIPAA.
Knowledge of or ability to quickly learn and apply specific data requirements.
Proficiency with Microsoft applications, including Word, Excel, and Outlook; experience with Electronic Health Record systems (myAvatar preferred).
Excellent verbal and written communication and personal interaction skills, with an emphasis on customer service and support; ability to communicate technical information to non-technical persons.
Excellent analytical, time management, and organizational skills; detail oriented with consistently accurate results.
Ability to define problems, collect and analyze complex data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions, with the ability to provide guidance to others involved in a problem-solving process.
Ability to develop and maintain strong professional relationships with employees at all levels, clients, and vendors, and with varying educational, professional and economic backgrounds.
Ability to work effectively with minimal supervision, manage multiple duties and priorities, and maintain high standards for accuracy, productivity, and confidentiality.
Ability to function as a member of a team, leading within the scope of the position and contributing whenever possible.





CERTIFICATES, LICENSES & REGISTRATIONS


Must pass criminal background checks.

 PHYSICAL DEMANDS 

  To successfully perform the essential duties of this position, an individual must be able to sit at a desk for four or more hours a day, and use office equipment, including computer keyboard and mouse repetitively for four or more hours per day. Individuals must be able to engage persons over the phone and in-person by voice. Regular attendance is an essential function of the position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to assist individuals with disabilities to perform essential position functions.
 


 LIMITATIONS AND DISCLAIMER 


  The above position description is meant to describe the general nature and level of work performed; it is not intended as an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities and required skills for the position. Team members will be required to follow any other position-related instructions and to perform other duties requested by their supervisor in compliance with Federal and State laws. Requirements are representative of minimum levels of knowledge, skills and/or abilities necessary to perform each duty proficiently. Continued employment remains on an “at-will” basis.
  Perks at Sound!: 
 



 All Team Members at Sound working 40 hours per week will be eligible for the following benefits:


100% Paid Medical & Dental Insurance
      
Full time Team Member and child(ren) coverage until child's 26th birthday
Spouse/Domestic Partner coverage available (team member pays full cost)

Paid Life Insurance

2x annual salary + additional $25,000

Long Term Disability Insurance (60% monthly salary)

100% premiums paid by Sound

18 Days of Paid Rest and Relaxation (Vacation) - beginning first year
12 Days of Paid Sick Leave
9 Days of Paid Holidays
Health Savings Account (HSA)
Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)

for health care (limited) and dependent day care costs (pre-tax)

Employee Assistance Plan (EAP)

The Standard

Sound retirement plan:

401(k) plan (organization contribution) – Sound contributes 3% to team members plan even if you don’t.
Team members are 100% vested; team members may contribute to their own plan

Paid Training

Free in-house professional training and $400 annually + 3 paid days off-site training

Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF)
Service Award - at 5,10,15,20 & 25 years of service

 We are seeking a proactive and analytical Business Intelligence (BI) Co-op to support a project focused on evaluating BI products available in the market. The primary goal of this co-op position is to conduct a comprehensive analysis of BI tools and platforms, assessing their features, benefits, and suitability for various business needs. The co-op will deliver a detailed evaluation report with actionable recommendations for potential adoption or integration.  Key Responsibilities:

 Market Research: Conduct extensive research on current BI products and platforms, including industry leaders and emerging solutions.
 Feature Analysis: Evaluate the features, functionalities, and user experience of different BI tools, including dashboards, reporting capabilities, and data integration options.
 Comparative Assessment: Compare BI products based on key criteria such as cost, scalability, ease of use, support, and compatibility with existing systems.
 Stakeholder Interviews: Engage with internal stakeholders to understand their BI needs and preferences to inform the evaluation process.
 Data Collection: Gather and analyze product data, customer reviews, case studies, and expert opinions to support the evaluation.
 Documentation: Compile findings into a structured report that includes a comparative analysis, recommendations, and potential benefits of each BI solution.
 Presentation: Prepare and present your findings to key stakeholders, highlighting key insights and recommendations for potential adoption.
 Qualifications:

 Education: Currently pursuing a degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
 Technical Skills: Familiarity with BI tools and basic knowledge of data warehousing concepts is a plus. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel or similar tools for data analysis.
 Analytical Skills: Strong analytical abilities with a focus on detailed assessment and comparative analysis.
 Research Skills: Ability to conduct thorough market research and synthesize complex information.
 Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present findings clearly and persuasively.
 Attention to Detail: Meticulous approach to evaluating product features and documenting findings.
 Preferred Skills:

Experience or coursework related to business intelligence or data analytics.
Basic understanding of BI tool functionalities and market trends.
Prior experience in research or evaluation projects is a plus.
 Benefits:

Hands-on experience in evaluating and comparing BI products from a market perspective.
Opportunity to work on a high-impact project with direct implications for business decision-making.
Guidance and mentorship from experienced BI professionals.
Development of skills in market research, data analysis, and report presentation.
Networking opportunities within the company and industry.

Position Purpose












The Data Analyst will join a collaborative, centralized team grounded in improvement science to participate in projects that promote a culture of excellence.

The Data Analyst will be responsible for acquisition, analysis, interpretation, and reporting of sensitive data to support performance measurement and health system improvement efforts. They must be able to work independently, and collaboratively, to locate and validate data, identify data requirements, and communicate data specifications to team members and leaders. They must be able to develop reporting/analytic solutions, but also be able to draw meaningful conclusions and make recommendations for actions.

The Data Analyst will leverage software applications to design solutions and perform detailed data mapping and analysis. They will not only manage data and design new processes but will be accountable for the timely and accurate production of routine internal and external monitoring reports and special projects. This requires experience working with databases, along with creativity, curiosity, and initiative to evolve the tools and reporting systems to meet the priorities of a dynamic healthcare environment. They will need an understanding of data management, as well as manipulation and interpretation of large databases.

















Nature and Scope













Primary Responsibilities:
This role will be serving the Human Resources, Payroll, Benefits, and Finance areas.

Responsible for acquiring, accessing, validating, querying, and analyzing data from data repositories using available tools (including Alteryx, Python, R, SQL, Power BI, or Microsoft Azure applications).


Data Analysis and Interpretation:

o Utilize statistical techniques and data mining methodologies to analyze complex clinical datasets. Identify trends, patterns, and correlations within the data to derive meaningful insights and actionable recommendations.
o Write scripts to integrate data, conduct exploratory data analysis to discover hidden trends, apply machine learning to train predictive models, and use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn complex sets of disparate data points into objective answers that inform decisions.
o Utilize statistical analysis, unsupervised machine learning, supervised machine learning, and deep learning as needed.

Biostatistical Research Support: Collaborate with researchers and clinicians to provide analytical support for clinical studies and research projects. Assist in study design, sample size estimation, data collection methods, and statistical analysis plans.


Data Visualization and Reporting:

o Create clear and concise visualizations, reports, and dashboards to communicate data-driven insights to investigators.
o Present findings in a compelling manner, tailored to the target audience. Generate publication quality graphs and write associated manuscript sections to describe methodology and results in detail for inclusion in scientific publications.
o Clearly and effectively communicate results in writing and in oral presentations.

Quality Assurance: Ensure the accuracy and reliability of clinical data by conducting quality assurance checks and implementing data validation procedures. Identify and resolve data discrepancies or anomalies.


Compliance and Data Privacy: Adhere to regulatory requirements and maintain strict confidentiality of patient health information (PHI) in accordance with privacy laws and ethical guidelines such as HIPAA.


Continuous Improvement: Stay abreast of industry trends, advancements in data analytics methodologies, and emerging technologies. Explore opportunities to enhance data collection, analysis, and reporting processes. Review scientific publications and literature to validate theories and models.


Incumbent Must Possess:

A minimum of three years of experience.


Must have a background in biological, epidemiological, or sociological data analysis, with a specific focus in clinical datasets.


EXPERIENCE WITH CLINICAL DATA SETS PREFERRED TO BE CONSIDERED.


Must have experience with data visualization tools (i.e., Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik) and techniques to develop and deliver impactful data models and data visualizations.


Must have experience with querying or analyzing data to answer questions and solve problems and familiarity with different databases.


Must exhibit proficiency in data analysis and statistical software including Alteryx, R, Python, SAS, SPSS, SQL, Power BI DAX, and other relevant programming environments.


Must have experience with statistics and statistical analysis of data and general algorithm development.


Must have strong analytical skills with the ability to work with a variety of large and complex datasets including (but not limited to) basic research datasets and clinical data.


Must have experience with electronic medical records.


Must possess excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively convey complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.


Must possess strong attention to detail, problem-solving abilities, and the capacity to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.


This position does not provide patient care. This role can be either remote or hybrid.

















Disclaimer








The foregoing description is not intended and should not be construed to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills and efforts or work conditions associated with the job. It is intended to be an accurate reflection of the general nature and level of the job.

















Minimum Qualifications Requirements - Required and/or Preferred












Name


Description




Education:


Must have working-level knowledge of the English language, including reading, writing, and speaking English. Master’s degree with 2 years’ experience preferred; bachelor’s degree with 5 years of equivalent experience will be considered in place of master’s degree requirement; AA or no degree with 10 years’ experience.




Experience:


Requires a minimum of five (5) years’ experience with at least three (3) years working in data management, analysis, governance, reporting, or other BI related experience. Requires least two (2) years healthcare data experience; more is preferred. SQL and statistical experience and proficiency is required.




License(s):


None




Certification(s):


Ability to obtain Epic System’s Cogito Fundamentals Certificate is required within 12 months of hire. Must stay current on new version certification as applicable.




Computer / Typing:


Must be proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, including Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word and can use the computer to complete online learning requirements for job-specific competencies, access online forms and policies, complete online benefits enrollment, etc.

This position is the first level within the Business Analysis job family.
 

 Demonstrates understanding of FM Boiler Re’s business and business processes.

 Documents the results/needs of department activities using appropriate templates, tools and tracking. Creates reports and works with I/S when necessary to address reporting requests.

 Liase with management to understand workload priorities. Plan and organize workflow to meet all department objectives. Manage the coordination and distribution of work.

 Experience

 Skills - "the how" needed to successfully deliver "the what"

  ABARTA Coca-Cola Beverages is a family-owned company committed to being a visible, engaged partner to the customers and communities we serve. We value diversity and individuality and when you thrive, we thrive. ABARTA offers the perks of a large corporation with the personalized touch of a smaller company. We are a workplace that encourages sharing ideas in a supportive environment, growing professionally, maintaining a healthy work/life balance, and interacting with all levels of the organization. We would love for you to become a part of our family to help make our vision of Quenching the Thirst of Our Neighbors a reality!


 Summary:


  ABARTA Coca-Cola Beverages, LLC is seeking to hire an HRIS Analyst who serves as the point of contact to respond to employee and manager inquiries through telephone and email support regarding all HR systems including SAP's Employee Central, EC Payroll, and SuccessFactors. Provides accurate information about modules to resolve employee inquiries and matters on a timely basis, while maintaining a high level of customer service. Escalates time-consuming and complex issues and inquiries to HR leadership.


 Responsibilities:


Provide day-to-day support to Employee Central users for issues such as badge numbers, workflow and general navigation in all modules.
Partner with CCBSS to resolve associate questions accurately and timely.
Assist teammates with the use of our self-service portal and knowledge base to fulfill future needs independently when practical to do so.
Distribute reports from Employee Central modules (i.e., Learning, Performance, Compensation, Recruiting, EC core).
Collaborate with CCBSS Learning Administrator to maintain and administer Learning Management System and Enable Now.
Work with CCBSS and CONA on open incidents to provide resolution through accurate and timely information to teammates who correspond with the HR Service Center with a wide array of matters.
In conjunction with CCBSS and Cap Gemini team, develop and execute test cases for Onboarding project and additional upcoming mini projects (e.g. Career Paths, Snowflake).
Cross train in Workforce Solutions and Snowflake to ensure coverage and support for other HRIS functions.
Other duties, as assigned.

High School Diploma or GED; Bachelor's degree preferred.

  Posted Job Title
  Data Analyst (Department of Radiology)
 

  Job Profile Title
  Data Analyst C
 

  Job Description Summary
  The Perelman School of Medicine at the University of Pennsylvania is the oldest and one of the finest medical schools in the United States. Penn is rich in tradition and heritage and at the same time consistently at the forefront of new developments and innovations in medical education and research. Since its founding in 1765 the School has been a strong presence in the community and prides itself on educating the leaders of tomorrow in patient care, biomedical research, and medical education. http://www.med.upenn.edu/
 

  Job Description
 

  DiCIPHR (Diffusion & Connectomics in Precision Healthcare Research) Lab invites applications for Data Analyst positions. This role focuses on processing, quality control, and statistical analysis of brain MRI data, including structural, functional, and diffusion MRI, as well as clinical and histological data. As a key member of our research team, you will contribute to cutting-edge projects exploring the intricacies of brain function and structure in traumatic brain injury, autism and brain tumors. This is an on-site position, starting immediately.
 

 The DiCIPHR Lab (www.diciphrlab.com), led by Dr. Ragini Verma, is dedicated to patient-oriented neuroimaging research, aiming to advance our understanding of the association of disease related structural and functional connectivity alterations in the brain, and symptoms. Such clinically focused investigations are rooted in advanced mathematical and computational tools for diffusion MRI analysis, as well as multiparametric connectomics. These tools encompass processing pipelines, automated quality control and multi-site harmonization and have enabled investigations in sex differences, brain development, autism, brain tumor, and traumatic brain injury. Investigation of these clinical questions have been further facilitated by network neuroscience research in communication schemes, network reorganization strategies, as well as pre-clinical mechanistic investigations.
 

 Key Responsibilities:

Perform data processing and quality control for structural, functional, and diffusion MRI data.
Utilize programming languages such as Python, MATLAB, and R to develop and implement analytical tools and workflows.
Conduct statistical analyses to extract meaningful insights from complex imaging datasets.
Collaborate with team members to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data analyses, and present results to collaborators and at
 conferences. Position is contingent on grant funding.
 

 Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Neuroscience, or related fields and 2-3 years of experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience required.
Strong background in computer programming, including proficiency in Python, MATLAB, and R.
Familiarity with neuroimaging software and tools such as AFNI, FreeSurfer, FSL, MRtrix3, DIPY, SPM.
Solid understanding of statistical analysis methods and their application to complex datasets.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.



 Additional qualifications:

Experience in analyzing structural, functional, and diffusion MRI data.
Knowledge of advanced quantitative methods, including machine learning and mixed models, as well as an exposure to AI.
Proficient in handling website updates and social media accounts



 Working Conditions Office, Library, Computer Room
 

 Physical Effort Typically sitting at desk or table
 


  Job Location - City, State
  Philadelphia, PennsylvaniaData Analyst C
 

  Department / School
  Perelman School of Medicine

  $51,824.00 - $85,000.00 Annual Rate

If you apply when you’re newly hired, you won’t have to provide proof of good health or be subject to underwriting requirements.     Wellness and Work-life Resources: Penn is committed to supporting our faculty and staff as they balance the competing demands of work and personal life. That’s why we offer a wide variety of programs and resources to help you care for your health, your family, and your work-life balance.

As a member of the Penn community, you’re right in the middle of the excitement—and you and your family can enjoy many of these activities for free.

 About FIS


FIS is at the forefront of financial technology, providing innovative solutions to financial institutions and businesses globally. Our innovative products and services enable clients to achieve success and growth in the ever-evolving fintech landscape.



 About the Team



The Analytics team in Banking Technology Development is dedicated to driving insights and value from our vast array of data assets. Our team collaborates across multiple business units, leveraging advanced analytics, data visualization, and effective data storytelling to support strategic decision-making and operational excellence.



 Who we need



We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Data Analyst to join our Analytics team. This role will be pivotal in harnessing data to provide actionable insights, supporting strategic initiatives, and driving business growth. The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical mindset, exceptional problem-solving abilities, and a proven track record of leveraging data to influence business outcomes.



 What you will be doing



Transform and prepare new and existing data sets to be leveraged in analytical models.




Conduct complex data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights.




Utilize statistical techniques and advanced analytics to build predictive models and support strategic initiatives.




Work closely with cross-functional teams: product development, HR, development and finance.




Use data storytelling to present findings and recommendations to senior leadership and stakeholders.




Ensure data quality and integrity by implementing best practices for data governance, cleansing, and validation.




Collaborate with data engineering teams to optimize data pipelines and infrastructure.




 What you Bring



A bachelor's or master's degree in data science, Statistics, Computer Science, or Economics.




5 years of experience in data analysis, (experience in fintech, financial services, or technology is a bonus).




Experience with data visualization tools, statistical programming software. (Microsoft ecosystem is a bonus).




Expert level proficiency in SQL and experience with large-scale databases.




Experience in statistical modelling, predictive analytics, and data mining techniques.




Able to transform data to meet requirements for analytical models.




Knowledge of data governance and best practices for data management.




Excellent communication and presentation skills, ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical audiences.




Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.




 What we offer you



Being part of a leading fintech company that is shaping the future of finance.




Working in a collaborative and innovative environment with opportunities for growth and development.




Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.

  POSITION DUTIES AND QUALIFICATIONS
 

  SUMMARY OF DUTIES:
  Under direction, positions assigned to this classification are primarily responsible for operational functions and routine audits as well as providing non-routine statistical methods and data analytics to help business partners make sound decisions that enhance operations.
 

  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:*
 

  Position Specific Summary
 


   The GIS Data Analyst II position at the City of Tucson’s Water Department designs, builds, and maintains business intelligence, reporting, and data analysis needs to help business partners make sound decisions that enhance operations.
  




 Work is performed under the supervision of the Management Coordinator. This position does not supervise.
  



  Duties and Responsibilities
 





     Performs operational functions and routine audits using relational databases, geographic information systems software, and/or statistical programs to enhance business operations by assisting field technicians, maintenance and new development teams.
    







 Analyzes and interprets datasets using geographical information systems software, and or statistical programs to assist internal and external stakeholders to ensure that the City of Tucson and neighboring cities have safe and reliable water.
    







 Uses non-routine, data transformation tools to locate and map assets and infrastructure, including pipe networks, reservoirs to assist field crews and contractors maintain infrastructure.
    







 Manages and processes large geographic datasets to aid county, state and federal lawmakers in meeting water quality standards, i.e., identifying lead service lines, and EPA compliance etc.
    







 Aid in water conservation efforts by generating maps that allow teams to educate the public in storm water capture, retention and usage consultations.
    





     Creates and maintains projects on digital visualization platforms for internal and external clients for use in graphics and illustrations. Collaborates with cross-functional teams on spatial data projects.
    





     Assists in special projects. Develops and reviews standard operating procedures for periodic tasks. Provides backup to internal and external stakeholders to aid in field operations by collecting data as needed.
    





     Performs other duties as assigned.
    




  Working Conditions
 


  Mostly office environment.
 


All duties, responsibilities listed are subject to change.

Position Summary
The Department of Epidemiology at the Mailman School of Public Health is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to conduct quantitative analyses for two NIH-funded projects. The first project is entitled Community- and school-level policing, School Discipline, and Student Health Outcomes: Identifying the Adolescent Health Consequences of Racialized Criminalization and Securitization in New York City Schools. This project involves psychiatric and substance use epidemiology with a specific focus on adolescent health and mass criminalization and incarceration. The second project is entitled Substance Use Treatment and County Incarceration (STACI). This project examines how community-level exposure to mass incarceration can contribute to county substance use disorder treatment needs and affect treatment availability, use, and outcomes. A candidate with an interest in areas of health related to these projects is preferred. The successful candidate will have excellent written and oral communication skills, strong interpersonal and organizational skills, and attention to detail. Experience with managing large data frames, multi-level and longitudinal data analysis, and data visualization is critical.  This position will work with the principal investigators and other investigators to:

Conduct data acquisition, processing/cleaning, and linkages
Perform quantitative multivariate analyses to fulfill research aims
Conduct latent variable analysis and linear modeling
Contribute (as a co-author) to reports, manuscripts, figures, tables, slides, and other presentation materials based on study findings
Contribute to new and ongoing grant proposals as needed

Individuals from groups historically underrepresented in health-related research are strongly encouraged to apply. The position also has the potential to work in a similar capacity on the principal investigator’s other research projects.

Responsibilities

Conduct data acquisition, processing/coding, and linkages 35%
Conduct data analysis to fulfill research aims - 50% Write and edit research manuscripts, slides, and other materials - 10%
Perform other related duties & responsibilities as assigned/requested 5%

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's degree, plus three years of experience.


Preferred Qualifications

The candidate must have a master’s degree or equivalent in training, education, and/or experience in the fields of statistics or biostatistics. Proficiency in R and experience working with quantitative data management and analysis are essential.
Work experience in psychiatric or substance use epidemiology is preferred. Experience with STATA and ArcGIS is preferred. Interest in adolescent mental health, substance use treatment across the life course, and mass criminalization and incarceration is preferred.



Equal Opportunity Employer / Disability / Veteran
Columbia University is committed to the hiring of qualified local residents.

  Data Analyst Shalom Austin Dell Jewish Community Center 7300 Hart Ln Austin, TX 78731
 
Principal Responsibilities:
If you want to be a part of a growing organization and make a difference in the community, come work for Shalom Austin! Data Analyst *Candidates must currently reside in the greater Austin area or have plans to move to area*
 Compensation: 
? We'll pay you an annual salary of $55,000 to $60,000
 Our great benefits

We'll provide a FREE membership to the fitness and aquatics center, and offer you discounts on programs, including personal training.
We are a learning organization! Our staff have regular opportunities for training and continuing education.
We offer outstanding medical insurance coverage through Cigna, and we'll pay over 80% of the premium cost of our base plan on your behalf.
You will have the option to contribute to our 403(b) with and the opportunity for a company match.
We provide life and long-term disability insurance, and we pay 100% of the cost for you.
We will give you lots of paid time off. First-year employees receive: 18 days of paid time off, and more than 15 Jewish and Federal holidays.
We'll offer you up to a 50% discount for your kiddos in our amazing early childhood program, as enrollment allows.
You will have access to our amazing Employee Assistance Program (EAP).
We understand that you need a work/life balance and that you have commitments outside of the workplace, so we'll do our very best to offer you some flexibility in your work schedule.
We'll provide you with the opportunity to make a difference in the Central Texas Jewish community every day.

About the Job
We need you to fill the role of Data Analyst. This is a full-time, exempt level position. Under the direction of the CFO, the Data Analyst at Shalom Austin will play a crucial role in managing and optimizing our data systems to support the organization. You'll wow us by masterfully performing the following key duties and responsibilities:
Database Management:

Build and modify queries and exports across multiple databases (e.g., Raiser's Edge, Daxko, CampMinder).
Ensure data integrity and consistency across various databases.
Collaborate with other departments to optimize database performance and resolve database-related issues.
Review and clean data sets for accuracy and usability in bulk communications, global updates, and other applications.
Develop and implement data cleaning protocols and standards.
Conduct regular audits to ensure data quality.
Design and implement new automations to streamline data processes.
Monitor and optimize workflow efficiency to reduce manual efforts.
Document automation processes and provide training to team members.

 Data Analysis and Reporting:

Regularly use statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets.
Maintain and refresh existing dashboards, ensuring they reflect current data and insights.
Duplicate and modify dashboards to meet evolving needs.
Create interactive and user-friendly dashboards using tools like Power BI or Tableau.
Develop custom reports for internal and external stakeholders.
Ensure reports are accurate, clear, and tailored to the audience's needs.

 Data Maintenance:

Develop and maintain data entry protocols to improve efficiency and accuracy.
Coordinate with other departments to manage data entry needs.
Perform regular data backups and ensure data security.
Adhere to data integrity processes and ensure compliance with organizational policies and regulations.
Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with data standards.
Assist with data-related compliance reporting and documentation.
Work closely with the departments to understand data needs and provide appropriate support.
Collaborate with other departments to integrate data insights into broader organizational strategies.
Other duties as assigned.


Minimum Qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in data science, data analytics, or related field
Advanced proficiency of Microsoft Excel
Familiarity with data analysis software (Power BI, Tableau, Alteryx)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Exceptional organizational and teamwork skills
Strong sense of urgency with sensitivity to time pressures and ability to dynamically prioritize multiple deadlines.
Experience with donor databases preferred, including Blackbaud eCRM, Raiser's Edge, and Salesforce


Salary:
$55000
Agency Information: 
The Shalom Austin Jewish Community Center (JCC) is one of the four branches of Shalom Austin. The JCC is your place to connect with the community, build friendships, improve physical fitness and overall wellness, and attend programs with family and friends. The "J" is open to all. It welcomes and respects people of all ages, fitness levels, interests and religions. Located on the lush 40-acres of the Dell Jewish Community Campus, JCC members enjoy full access to the Sports & Fitness Complex, including the fitness center, free-weights room, full court gymnasium, aquatics center, tennis center and nature trail. Membership includes a variety of free in-person and online group fitness classes, access to youth and family programming, Early Childhood Program preschool, and after school activities. Members may also take advantage of early registration and discounts on programs and events such as summer camp (JCamps), enrichment classes, adult programming and more. The Jewish Community Center serves as the main programming division of the Jewish Community Association of Austin. The key programming areas under the JCC umbrella include Early Childhood, Sports & Fitness, Youth & Teen Services, and Jewish cultural and educational programs. JCC members enjoy full access to our outstanding Sports & Fitness facilities and also receive discounts on JCC programming such as JCC Camps, enrichment classes, special cultural events, and more. The JCC is a beneficiary of the Jewish Federation of Greater Austin Annual Campaign.

Currently a hybrid remote position: Telework 3 days, must be in the office on Wednesdays
Core Hours: 9:30am - 3:00pm with flex hours outside of the core hours.
Duties
· Review incoming FOIA requests
· Entering incoming FOIA requests into FOIAonline tracking system.
· Reviewing incoming FOIA requests and understanding BIS regulations, program offices and activities to determine where searches must be tasked.
· Consulting with subject matter experts to determine where searches need to be conducted and what search terms should be used.
· Determining whether the searches should be done by individual employees or enterprise searches by OCIO.
· Drafting query requests to OCIO based on the search terms identified.
· Perform searches in Microsoft Outlook.
· Coordinate searches for responsive documents.
· Conduct legal research as needed to determine proper application of the Freedom of Information Act and legal precedent to requests.
· Monitoring status of searches (program offices and OCIO) to ensure timely responses.
· Ensuring the searches cover the entire scope of the request.
· Documenting details of searches for responsive records.
· Reviewing records in consultation with subject matter experts to determine sensitivity of information requested.
· Apply FOIA exemptions to BIS documents with an understanding of BIS regulations.
· Placing redactions on requested records consistent with applicable FOIA exemptions and ensure adherence to BIS regulations.
· Proficient with Adobe Acrobat Pro software and its tools to compile responsive records for redactions, stamping, sanitizing and transmitting.
· Compiling information for FOIA weekly, quarterly, and annual reporting requirements.
· Retrieving reports from FOIAonline, analyzing the data, and giving recommendations and guidance based on the analysis.
· Utilizing Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Power Point software to analyze data, summarize recommendations and deliver presentations.
· Compiling data and statistics to respond to data calls from the Department or the Office of General Counsel.
· Attending monthly FOIA Council meetings.
· Creating and updating template letters.
· Drafting FOIA letters, including acknowledgement, response, and closure.
· Reviewing redaction work of others to ensure consistency and accuracy of redactions.
· Ensuring completeness of each FOIA case file. Case files should include, but are not limited to incoming requests, search documentation, FOIA certifications, responsive record(s) (clean versions, marked version, and redacted versions), email communication concerning the request, response letter to the requester, and any supporting documentations. Each file should be clearly labeled and categorized. Case files is saved on the OPEM shared drive. Responsive records should be redacted and date stamped in Adobe Acrobat Pro and delivered in one PDF.
· Assisting with updating and maintaining the BIS FOIA website and posting frequently requested records.
· Developing FOIA program manual for BIS FOIA program.
· Assisting BIS employees and managers in implementing DOC and BIS FOIA policy and procedures.
DELIVERABLE SCHEDULE
The FOIA Specialist shall provide the following as deliverables:
A. Submit weekly progress reports to the FOIA/PA Officer.
B. Manage FOIA related activities and processes documents related to FOIA.
QUALIFICATIONS
5-7 years or more of strong knowledge of the FOIA and Privacy Act.
Must be able to utilize Microsoft Office software (Access, Adobe, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook).
Minimum Education: Bachelor’s degree.

At TurboTenant, we believe that the key to successful marketing lies in data-driven insights and strategic analysis. As a Marketing Data Analyst, you'll be at the heart of our efforts to reach our ideal audience of landlords through strategic decision-making and granular performance measurement that uncover actionable insights driving our growth. We're passionate about using data to make informed decisions and empowering our marketing team to deliver impactful results.
Joining our team means being part of a dynamic, innovative environment where your analytical skills will directly influence our marketing strategies. You'll have the opportunity to take ownership of TurboTenant's marketing data and play a crucial role in shaping the future of our marketing efforts. If you thrive on turning data into strategic actions and enjoy making a tangible impact, this is the role for you.
 Who we are looking for:
We are looking for a passionate and inquisitive Marketing Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics team, with a strong focus on bridging the gap between the Data and Marketing teams. This role will support the Marketing team with reporting and ad hoc requests, while also playing a crucial role in the data management and organization responsibilities of the data team. We're seeking someone who can elevate our marketing analytics efforts and drive impactful, data-driven strategies.
 As a Marketing Data Analyst at TurboTenant, you will:

Utilize comprehensive reporting tools, SQL, and GA4 to conduct ad-hoc analyses, monitor campaign performance, and create compelling visualizations.
Support the Marketing team by delivering easy-to-digest data and actionable insights, empowering them to make informed, data-driven decisions.
Lead the management and integration of marketing data from various sources.
Be responsible for ETL processes to bring new data into TurboTenant's data lake, ensuring that the Marketing department has access to comprehensive and accurate data from all essential sources.
Enjoy the freedom to conduct independent BI research, analyze data proactively, and identify areas for improvement.
Have the autonomy to recognize problems or opportunities at an organizational level and take action to implement data-driven solutions that drive meaningful impact across the company.
Oversee the accuracy and organization of TurboTenant's data lake in collaboration with the Data Team.
Automate and maintain data processes, integrate new data sources, and update Metabase reports to reflect product changes.
Connect user behavior with data and create comprehensive visualizations for KPIs and overall business performance.

To be successful in this role, you must have:

At least 2+ years in a Marketing Analytics role, with a strong background in analyzing and interpreting complex data.
The ability to write complex, highly-optimized SQL queries, experience with Athena/Presto or Postgres preferred.
Proficiency in Excel functions such as Index Match, Pivot Tables, SumIf, Vlookup, and If statements, along with the ability to produce clear and insightful graphs.
At least 1+ years of hands-on experience leveraging GA4 for insights and performance measurement.In-depth knowledge of key metrics like ROAS, ROI, CAC, CPSU, LTV, Churn Rates, CPA, CPC, CPM, and CAC Payback, and how they interrelate.
Experience using a data visualization platform (bonus points for Metabase) to create clear, impactful visual representations of data.
Deep experience working with complex attribution models to extract actionable insights that drive strategic decisions and optimize spend.
Experience with digital media platforms like Google Ads Campaign Manager, Facebook Ad Manager, and other digital tools.
Ability to effectively interpret data and present it in easy-to-understand visualizations that support decision-making.
A demonstrated ability to manage projects independently and work autonomously to meet goals.

Bonus points if you have:

Programming experience with Python or R.
Knowledge of AWS S3, Glue, and Athena for data storage and processing.
Familiarity with API integration and data ETL processes.
Understanding or experience with Halo Analysis.
Familiarity with GitHub or other code version control platforms.

TurboTenant has offices in Fort Collins and Denver, Colorado. Face-to-face time is an essential aspect of the role, and the ideal candidate for this role would be expected in the Denver office once a week (more if preferred).


About Us:

At TurboTenant, we simplify the complex and intimidating process of managing your own rental property. And we do it through an elegant software platform for small, "do-it-yourself" landlords and their tenants. But don't take our word for it. Read reviews from some of our 600,000+ landlords.
 Our Be Better Culture
At TurboTenant, we live by the Be Better mantra. Our high performance culture makes us relentless in our efforts to Be Better at serving our landlords and renters, and in unlocking the potential in one another.
 What does our Be Better culture mean to you?


You'll be in an environment that pushes you to reach your potential.


You'll make a massive impact on our landlords, renters, company, and the proptech industry.


You'll be on the highest performing team of your career.


We're also proud to offer:

Competitive compensation and PTO package
Equity - an owner's mindset is a big part of being a member of the TurboTeam
Comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans - with multiple plans covered at 100%
8 paid holidays per year + a paid day off for your birthday

Netflix is one of the world’s leading entertainment services with 278 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

 The Role
Netflix is one of the world's entertainment services, with 278 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and change their plans at any time.

As a global company, Netflix’s customers come from diverse backgrounds. Each of these backgrounds allows them to experience Netflix in their own unique way. Ultimately, this joy is rooted in our customers’ ability to trust Netflix. At Netflix, we earn this trust through our actions every day, and we work hard to continue to build this trust with our customers throughout the world.

Our team uses data for the consumer product security in two ways: 1) provide insights into effectiveness of security measures across products, and 2) build intelligence to address fraud in scale. Examples of fraud we deal with include device compromise, content piracy, service abuse and more.

We achieve our goals through both technical work on the team and cross-functional partnerships. We are looking for a security engineer to join our team to drive security metrics as well as data solutions for detection and prevention across the fraud landscape.

 What you will work on:
The person in this role will drive insights and discovery of fraud in our ecosystem by understanding our infrastructure, and product, identifying high risk areas, and driving changes to our anomaly detection and product experiences. You will leverage your security and fraud prevention expertise to analyze patterns, identify new signals, and recommend adjustments based on impact to our customers and Netflix.

Develop data-driven insights to influence our device & product security strategy, including identifying new signals for anomaly detection
Compile and track anomalous request patterns and identify potential mitigations
Plan and recommend changes to increase the security of the device and content security
Analyze error logs to quantify potential device-level vulnerabilities
Develop characterizations of request attributes across a diverse device and client ecosystem to quantify potential automation
Build insights into security and identity of the Netflix diverse and large-scale device ecosystem and develop dashboards to cascade the insights to a wide range of stakeholders


 Desired skills and background:

Passionate about protecting our customers & product
Familiarity with various aspects of fraud and abuse types, including device compromise, DRM compromise, or content piracy.
Experience with analytics (SQL (Presto, sparkSql, python)) and critical thinking.
A strong communicator & collaborator in varying contexts & environments.


We are looking for thoughtful professionals who enable our mission and support our culture of freedom and responsibility. You can learn more about life at Netflix by watching our security talks or exploring our open source work.

The Netflix culture permeates our work environment. It determines who we hire, how we work together, and how we make decisions. It encourages us to bring our best every day while valuing collaboration over individual achievement.

At Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location.

The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $100,000 - $720,000
 This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

Job is open for no less than 7 days and will be removed when the position is filled.

 Business Analyst Job Responsibilities:

Elicits, analyzes, specifies, and validates the business needs of stakeholders, be they customers or end users.
Collaborates with project sponsors to determine project scope and vision.
Identifies project stakeholders and establishes customer classes, as well as their characteristics.
Conducts interviews to gather customer requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
Identifies and establishes scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics.
Works with stakeholders and project team to prioritize collected requirements.
Researches, reviews, and analyzes the effectiveness and efficiency of existing requirements-gathering processes and develops strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes.
Assists in conducting research on products to meet agreed-upon requirements and to support purchasing efforts.
Participates in the QA of purchased solutions to ensure features and functions have been enabled and optimized.
Participates in the selection of any requirements documentation software solutions that the organization may opt to use.
Analyzes and verifies requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards.
Develops and utilizes standard templates to accurately and concisely write requirements specifications.
Translates conceptual customer requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project teams.
Creates process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team.
Develops and conduct peer reviews of the business requirements to ensure that requirement specifications are correctly interpreted.
Assists with the interpretation of customer requirements into feasible options, and communicating these back to the business stakeholders.
Manages and tracks the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforces and redefines as necessary.
Communicates changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements — verbally or through written documentation — to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.
Provides guidance and/or instruction to junior staff members.

Business Analyst Qualifications / Skills:

Able to exercise independent judgment and take action on it
Excellent analytical, mathematical, and creative problem-solving skills
Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail
Highly self-motivated and directed
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure
Strong customer service orientation
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment

Education, Experience, and Licensing Requirements:

College diploma or university degree in the field of business administration, finance, or information systems
Three to five years related work experience
Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development
Demonstrated project management skills and project management software skills, including planning, organizing, and managing resources
Working knowledge of Windows office systems

Job Description

 About Altera:

Altera empowers customers to unlock the full potential of data through cutting-edge programmable platforms. In Q4 2023, Intel announced Altera will be reported as a separate business unit beginning on January 1, 2024 with ongoing support from Intel. This will give Altera the autonomy and flexibility it needs to fully accelerate its growth and more effectively compete in the FPGA industry, which serves a broad array of markets, including the data center, communications, industrial, automotive, aerospace and defense sectors.
This position is associated to that standalone business strategy and is expected to fully transition to a standalone company at some time in the future.  About the Role:

This is a great opportunity to get exposure to a startup and help standing up Altera.

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Business Analyst to join our Altera Talent team. In this role, you will be responsible for bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions, ensuring that our projects align with the strategic goals of the organization.
 Responsibilities include but not limited to:

Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders to identify business needs and document requirements clearly and accurately.
Data Analysis: Analyze data to identify trends, insights, and opportunities for improvement.
Process Improvement: Document business processes and recommend solutions to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
Project Support: Assist in project planning, execution, and monitoring, ensuring that deliverables meet quality standards and are completed on time.
Documentation: Create and maintain documentation related to business requirements, functional specifications, and project progress.
Testing Support: Develop and execute test plans to validate that solutions meet business needs and requirements.
Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users as needed, ensuring smooth implementation of new processes and systems.

 Qualifications

 You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.

 Minimum Qualifications 

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field


5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar role within HR and/or talent functions


 Preferred Qualifications 

Technical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL), business intelligence software (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and business process documentation
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders
Experience with program/project management and key stakeholders’ management, leading projects to completion


This position is not eligible for Intel Immigration sponsorship
 Inside this Business Group The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.
 Other Locations US, OR, Hillsboro; US, CA, San Jose
 Posting Statement All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.
 Benefits We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here.  Annual Salary Range for jobs which could be performed in the US $99,487.00-$149,235.00

Salary range dependent on a number of factors including location and experience

 Working Model This role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site. In certain circumstances the work model may change to accommodate business needs.

     What to Expect

 The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for creating, maintaining, deploying, all forms of reporting for internal customers. You will work collaboratively with the BI (Business Intelligence) Staff, other IT staff, and business stakeholders with the goal of delivering actionable data analytics. This position plays multiple roles including data architect, data modeler, SQL programmer, report writer, report designer, and project manager.

 Essential Functions
 Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Design, build, and deploy business intelligence reports, self-service reports, and dashboards using a variety of front-end visualization tools such as Tableau, SSRS and Crystal Reports
    
Test and validate underlying report data; convey the key insights or “story” the data to reveal in a visual format that is grouped, summarized, or formatted to be easily consumed, understood, insightful and actionable
Provide Direction and Guidance to other Business Intelligence Analysts.

Work with large, messy, disparate datasets and conduct ad-hoc analyses to quickly inform critical business decisions. Create ETLs or processes that pull data from multiple places and centralize it in one data source.
Review and optimize existing queries written by other developers; perform ongoing monitoring and refinement of reports and BI solutions.
Participate in innovative technology evaluation and ensure alignment of business unit data and analytics practices with enterprise data processes and practices.
Develop and maintain operating procedures and support documentation for all reporting infrastructure.
Proactively engage in continuous improvement efforts for all reports and their operation.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work cross-functionally.
Perform other duties as assigned.

 Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, or a related field.
3-5 years of experience in IT and Business Intelligence creating advanced reports using tools such as Tableau (or other BI tools like Power BI, Qlik, or Tibco), SSRS, SSIS, T-SQL, MS SQL Server preferred.
A minimum of 3 years of experience designing, writing, and maintaining Crystal Reports.

 Preferred Qualifications

Prior experience in Business Intelligence development, planning, design, configuration, coding, and troubleshooting of BI tools preferred.
Strong understanding of database systems and data warehouse architecture preferred.
Familiar with any ERP database schemas and departmental processes preferred.
Experience with Python or other scripting language is a plus.

 Required Skills/Abilities

Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical individuals.

 Work Environment/Physical Demands/Travel
This job operates in a professional business office or home office where standard office equipment is routinely used, such as computers, photocopy machines, fax machines, telephones and filing cabinets. This position is largely a sedentary role. Must be able to lift 30 pounds at times. Must be able to access and navigate each department at the organization’s facilities.

 This is a full-time position, on-site at Potter Headquarters. A hybrid work format will be an option after thorough understanding of the Potter Global Technologies global network. The hours of work are Monday through Friday, 40 hours per week. An occasional shift in hours may be necessary to accommodate business needs.

 Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of an employee for this job. Activities, duties and responsibilities may change at any time with or without notice.

Responsibilities

Responsible for creating and generating reports that provide analytics to the global recruiting team up to executive management; develop and manage weekly, monthly & quarterly reports
