 Overview: 
  Job specifications are intended to present a descriptive list of the range of duties performed by employees. Specifications are not intended to reflect all duties performed within the job.
 SUMMARY 

  We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to join our Human Performance Optimization Program at Langley AFB in Hampton, VA. The ideal candidate will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data sets to provide actionable insights that support pilot training and performance optimization initiatives. He/she will be focused on enhancing the physical and cognitive capabilities of US Air Force Airmen through data analytics. The candidate must have some statistics data analytics skills and experience to interpret various forms of large complex datasets and present it in a useful and easy-to-understand manner This role is essential in driving data-driven decisions that enhance pilot readiness and operational effectiveness.
 

 Langley AFB, Hampton, VA (Hybrid Remote-3 days onsite - 2 days remote)
 Responsibilities: 
  ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

 The Essential Duties and Responsibilities are intended to present a descriptive list of the range of duties performed for this position and are not intended to reflect all duties performed within the job. Other duties may be assigned. 



Data Collection and Management:


Collect and manage large datasets from various sources, including physiological, cognitive, and operational performance metrics.
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and consistency across all data sources.


 Data Analysis and Interpretation:


Analyze complex datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations that impact pilot performance.
Utilize statistical methods and data analysis tools to provide insights and recommendations.


 Reporting and Visualization:


Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations that communicate key findings and performance metrics to stakeholders.
Present data insights in a clear and concise manner to non-technical audiences, including program managers, human performance specialists, and military leadership.


 Performance Monitoring:


Track and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) related to pilot training and operational readiness.
Evaluate the effectiveness of training programs and interventions through data-driven analysis.


 Collaboration and Support:


Work closely with cross-functional teams, including database programmers, human performance specialists, and vendors, to ensure data solutions meet program needs.
Ability to prioritize and execute tasks in a high functioning environment.
Strong critical thinking skills and attention to detail.
Provide support and training to team members on data analysis tools and best practices.


 Predictive Modeling and Machine Learning:


Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms to forecast performance outcomes and identify potential areas for improvement.
Apply advanced analytics techniques to enhance decision-making processes.


 Documentation and Compliance:


Maintain comprehensive documentation of data analysis processes, methodologies, and findings.
Ensure compliance with data protection regulations and organizational policies.

 Qualifications: 
 
 QUALIFICATIONS - EXPERIENCE, EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATION


 To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to satisfactorily perform each essential duty. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 


Required (Minimum Necessary) Qualifications 


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field. In lieu of degree, an active Data Science/Data Analytics certification(s) or training/certificate(s) obtained within the last 3 years.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, with a strong background in data collection, analysis, and visualization.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, and Excel.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Strong statistical analysis skills and familiarity with statistical software.
Excellent problem-solving skills with attention to detail, and solutions oriented.
Team oriented with the ability to work independently.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong critical thinking skills and attention to detail as reporting must be precise.


Ability to write comprehensive reports for non-technical audiences.
Contribute to data dictionary, standards, and maintaining documentation.
Ability to be flexible and adaptable regarding customer needs and technology.


Experience working with performance data, particularly in a military or high-performance context.
Knowledge of human performance optimization and related technologies.
Understanding of or the ability to learn physiological and cognitive performance metrics.
Experience with machine learning and predictive analytics.

Profile insightsFind out how your skills align with the job descriptionSkillsDo you have experience in Research?YesNo LocationChicago, IL 60612 Full job description
Mintel is in search of a research and market analyst for our Chicago office, with a working knowledge of/expertise in Technology, Media, and Gaming. The qualified Analyst will be a commercially-driven professional who understands how consumer research helps the world's largest and most creative companies grow their business.
The Analyst will contribute to our internationally recognized syndicated publications by applying their extensive consumer research knowledge and critical thinking to develop quantitative and qualitative research plans, analyze consumer and market data and write insightful research reports.
The Analyst works as part of a team, sharing ideas and insight, while taking ownership of specific subject areas. Main responsibilities include developing objectives, designing primary research, analyzing resulting data, writing reports, managing the reports processes, responding to client queries and working with Mintel's sales and marketing/PR teams.
 This is a Hybrid position based in Chicago.
 What You Will Be Doing:

Write insightful consumer lifestyle reports: Write 10 syndicated reports each year that combine consumer data with secondary research to create a full picture of the opportunity for brands. Define the report scope, identify key issues, design consumer research, conduct trade interviews, analyze data through to producing the final report.
Translate data into actionable recommendations: Use a combination of consumer, demographic, economic and market data to write forward-looking analyses.
Develop quantitative consumer surveys: Create online surveys to meet research objectives.
Conduct secondary research: Evaluate external resources to strengthen and support insights and recommendations (eg Census, Bureau of Labor Statistics and other public sources).
Client support: Respond to client requests for phone/video calls or shorter write-up on topics where they want your perspectives outside of the data/analysis in reports; present findings from Reports.
Build strong relationships: Collaborate with colleagues across the company, including the commercial side of the business, our consulting division and several other teams.

Who We Are Looking For:

A Researcher: Some experience in a relevant consumer/media/marketing research, shopper or consumer insights, branding or consulting role is preferred
A Skilled Writer: You are able to observe brand and consumer activity across a wide range of categories to create compelling stories of how consumer trends are evolving and create content that excites and inspires audiences with the latest trend thinking
Naturally Curious: You are naturally curious and great at navigating internal and external data, asking second and third level questions to see the patterns behind data to craft expert analysis to be used by clients. You are self-motivated, creative, able to think strategically, while following set processes with strong attention to detail
Self-Directed: You take initiative to solve problems and uncover opportunities. You have a self-sufficient work ethic; entrepreneurial in spirit and are naturally self-motivated
A Fast Learner: You are adaptable and thrive in a fast paced environment where client needs and processes may shift. You are digitally savvy and your familiarity with web-based tools gives you confidence to learn and navigate proprietary online systems
A Collaborator: You seek out opportunities to collaborate with peers in your department and across the organization to ultimately elevate our clients' experience

Equal Opportunity Employer: Race/Color/Sex/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Religion/National Origin/Disability/Vets

Job Summary  Assists in development, facilitation, and execution of Client Implementations. The 340b Implementation Analyst will interact with Pharmacy Services, Pharmacy/Store Operations, PBMs, Wholesalers, Sales, Clients, The Office of Pharmacy Affairs and other Walgreen Co Departments to setup and administer the 340b Program, and facilitates the 340b contracted pharmacy relationship for qualified covered entities and their patients; Establishes and maintains 340b implementation client contacts; Collaborates with Sales to provide programs and services customized to client' needs; Serves as liaison with multiple Walgreen business units to track all implementation activity; Analyzes utilization reports and recommends modifications for client programs; Responsible for collaborating with the RFP team on creating and reviewing RFP responses that accurately showcase 340b complete platform capabilities and differentiators; Responsible for Compliance Monitoring during implementation phase with new client. Executes assigned duties within implementation project plans and 340B business model. Works with Walgreens team, clients and stores to ensure the process is implemented and goes through integration. May execute entire implementation for smaller projects.

Responsible for 340b application system setup.
Completes and submits all government forms for HRSA registration.
Assists in developing complex client relationships and develops standard client relationships
Works with internal departments to track all outstanding deliverables for the implementation team.
Responsible for transition of client relationship from the implementation team to the operations team

Develops understanding of 340b statutes and guidelines to ensure client implementations are in compliance with those set forth by the Government.
Acts as a liaison between 340b Operations and the sales team

 In anticipated future growth among our Business Intelligence / Data & Analytics team, Orangetheory Fitness will be accepting applications for our Business Intelligence Analyst (Pool) position.



 Once received, your application will be entered into our Business Intelligence Analyst talent database, where you will be contacted (if selected) at the start of the recruiting process for any upcoming BIA openings.



    As part of the Business Intelligence team, this data and analytics professional will partner with business leaders across the organization to surface key metrics and unlock vital insights that drive data-informed decisions and guide business strategy. Our Business Intelligence team is business savvy, think critically, comfortable querying data, and seek to apply analytical methods and statistics. They collaborate with our data engineers to develop rich datasets that make it easy to answer pertinent questions. They also convert insights into better day-to-day decisions through the use of reports, models, and automation.
   


    JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
   


    Reporting & Analytics
   

Analyze business questions and communicate findings through briefs, presentations, reports or other media. Clarify and document the questions, how findings may be used, and the analysis approach.
Conduct impact analyses, leading to a deeper understanding of business performance; the member experience and fitness results.
Work with data engineers to augment existing datasets with metrics and categorizations that make it easier to answer common business and analysis questions and publish proper reports.
Build the company knowledge base of data-informed insights, documenting findings and promoting and communicating those findings through appropriate internal channels.
Develop internal and external documentation and training on Analytics products, such as dashboards, reports, KPI's, source data collection and transformation, data lineage and suggested use cases.



    Performance Expectations
   

Well versed in most of the functionality our BI platforms offer and able to make efficient use of them.
Familiarity with analytical methods- Ex. statistical significance, distributions, independent and dependent probabilities, confidence intervals etc. to answer business questions.
Being able to ask questions to fully understand the context and business question asked and how answering it will make a difference. Occasionally, help is required from senior analyst or manager to frame the problem.
Choose or propose a path of inquiry that is logical and coherent.
Typically, makes accurate inferences from the data, which may require some help from more senior analysts or manager to validate conclusions.
Identify key assumptions around perceived or real business problems and validates them before proceeding with the analysis
Present findings in an easy-to-understand way for business stakeholders, using COE practices.
Share and document approach and findings, making sure the rest of the team has visibility and can build on them.
Is recognized by business stakeholders as contributing to their decision-making processes or improving their operations.
Make accurate inferences from data. Know what the data says and what it doesn’t say and is transparent about shortcomings of the data. Suggests further analysis paths if the answer is not sufficiently conclusive.
Show interest and can speak the language of the business domain they are supporting (e.g., marketing, finance, operations). When presenting findings business stakeholders follow



    REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS / EXPERIENCE
   

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, business administration, economics, or related field with a focus on logic and quantitative analysis. MBA or experience in or with specific business functions is a plus.
Minimum 1 year of experience in reporting and analysis. Can demonstrate how to effectively communicate findings to stakeholders outside of the field of analytics.
Proficiency in querying and manipulating data using SQL. Know how to use subqueries, window and analytic functions, regular expressions. On the job experience with Python, R or similar languages is a plus.
Experience creating solutions using Power BI or any comparable data visualization tool
Understanding of data visualization best practices
Basic understanding of statistics (sampling, statistical significance).
Exposure to Data Warehouse principles and basic understanding of data modeling concepts and methodologies


 SKILLS & ABILITIES
   

Well organized. Thinks about how to do the work, then acts. Seeks to contextualize the work.
Demonstrates understanding of which analytic methods to use to answer certain types of questions.
Good interpersonal skills, seeks to understand others’ viewpoints, motivations, ways of thinking.
Shows curiosity about the industry and can explain how Orangetheory is differentiated.
Can articulate Orangetheory’s goals and strategic imperatives.
Respectfully challenges others’ approach or viewpoints when making inferences from data that are not logically or methodologically sound.
Able to contrast meaningful and poor metrics or KPI’s.
Can identify common biases that affect what questions are asked, which data is looked at and how results are interpreted



    SUPERVISORY REQUIREMENTS This position does not directly manage employees.
   


    TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS
   

    Travel may be required on an as-needed basis.
   


 Why Join Orangetheory Corporate?
   

    We offer a competitive salary along with exceptional benefits such as:
   

Free workouts at corporate studios & discounted classes at franchise owned studios
Healthcare Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision among many other supplemental benefits
Employer Paid Benefits: Long-Term Disability and Life Insurance
4 weeks of Paid Time Off + Designated Birthday & Charity PTO
11 Paid Holidays
Up to 12 Weeks of Fully Paid Parental Leave
Education & Tuition Reimbursement
State-of-the-Art Wellness Center at The Grove which includes 2 complimentary professional massages per year
401k Plan with Employer Contribution
Discounts on Orangetheory Fitness Retail
Employee Resource Groups (ERGS)
Flexible, Hybrid Work Schedules
Team Building, Employee Engagement activities and so much more



    WORK SCHEDULE
   

    Orangetheory Fitness currently observes the following hybrid work model for employees at our Boca Raton, FL and Seattle, WA offices:
   

Remote optional: Mondays and Fridays
On-site days: Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays



    DIVERSITY, EQUITY, AND INCLUSION STATEMENT
   

    Orangetheory is committed to encouraging, facilitating, and upholding an environment centered on diversity, equity, and inclusion across every facet of the Orangetheory brand. We will work to create a sustainable culture that supports a healthy space for learning and growing, valuing, and empowering every employee, inspiring a diverse franchise network, and uplifting the members and communities we serve.
   


    EEO STATEMENT
   

    Orangetheory Fitness provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated.

           Job Summary
          






 The Prospect Research & Data Analyst will help set and support the Development team’s data-driven strategy and build a data-fluent culture within the division. This role will demonstrate sound project management skills and a high level of professionalism, working both independently and in a team environment to ensure success. As a strategic partner, this role provides data-driven insights and strategy to help drive decision-making through prospect identification, wealth screenings, data analysis, reporting and completing robust prospect research profiles. This position is critical to overall Advancement success through the building of sustainable and broad-based annual, leadership, major, and principal gift pipelines.  FGCU is a member of the State University System of Florida and an Affirmative Action and Equal Employment Opportunity and Access Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, disability, sex, pregnancy, national origin, marital status, genetic predisposition, sexual orientation, gender identity/gender expression, veteran status, and any other protected class(es), as required by applicable state and federal law, as well as University regulations and policies.
   

    Job Description
   

    Typical duties may include but are not limited to:
   

Develops methodologies, reports, research, analytics, visual aids, and aggregations of data to identify new prospects and prioritize current donors to create and grow a high-quality, robust prospect pool for fundraiser qualification.
In partnership with the leadership team, designs and implements prospect management and fundraiser performance metrics tracking procedures and strategies, leveraging technological solutions to create efficiencies for fundraising success.
Analyzes data and creates reports to assist with Development planning and projections including campaign readiness assessments, gift potential of prospect pools, and overall strategy and execution for annual fundraising or campaign goals.
Conducts high-level research using a broad spectrum of public and specialized proprietary data sources. Retrieves, organizes, analyzes, synthesizes, and evaluates a prospect's financial capacity, ability to give, willingness to give, charitable interests, current and potential connections to the University, and philanthropic interests that align with FGCU’s priorities.
Proactively partners with the Director to create and manage portfolios and track fundraiser’s progress.
Uses independent judgment to assess comprehensive research and data analytics, providing insights and recommendations to fundraisers for informed targeted solicitations.
Manages wealth screening initiatives by querying, segmenting, reporting, and analyzing results to refine and prioritize large groups of prospects, identifying those with the highest capability and potential to give.
Oversees ResearchPoint Database, develops best practices and standards, runs batch screenings, oversees ResearchPoint to Raiser’s Edge integration, and creates research lists for various segments.
Executes annual Data Analytics screening. Works with internal partners for initial processing and final data integration. Completes data analysis, creates queries, makes recommendations on strategy, and provides prospect lists based on the assessments.
Tracks, maintains, monitors, and reports on donor qualification and retention, prospect meetings, and solicitations.
Collaborates with Advancement Services to export donor mailing lists for strategic events and oversees the data clean up and preparation of final mail house or email lists.



    Other Duties:
   

Performs other projects as assigned.



    Additional Job Description
   

    Required Qualifications:
   

This position requires either six years of directly related full-time experience or, as an alternative, a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution in an appropriate area of specialization and two years of full-time experience directly related to the job functions.
Professional experience in data analytics and/or prospect research.
Computer experience in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and Access).
Any appropriate combination of relevant education, experience, and/or certifications may be considered.



    Preferred Qualifications:
   

Master's Degree from an accredited institution in an appropriate area of specialization.
Donor research and analysis experience in a higher education fundraising environment.
Experience with Raiser’s Edge or similar fundraising databases.



    Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:
   

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including demonstrated ability to synthesize data found in research into clear and concise information.
Excellent project management skills, attention to detail, and proficiency in writing clearly and concisely.
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and Access) and other databases.
Ability to interact in a professional manner with a diverse group of staff, faculty, students, and the community in a service-oriented environment.
Ability to handle multiple tasks and work under stress.
Ability to manage multiple and complex projects, meet deadlines, and adapt to changing priorities and needs.
Ability to maintain confidentiality and discretion at all times.
Ability to thrive in an organization that values the diversity of its student body and workforce and actively promotes an equitable environment.



    Pay Grade: 18

Performance Health is seeking a Forecast Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will work closely with the Commercial Marketplace teams to create a global forecast plan for all marketplace channels. The individual will leverage data intelligence from multiple marketplace channels to provide forecast insights to the demand planning team. They will play an integral part in the sales and operations planning process for the Marketplace team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining reporting metrics and models to support the supply chain demand planning team.

 Essential Job Duties & Responsibilities

Leverage back forecasting and historical data and insights from marketplace connections, not limited to Rithum or NetSuite, to build future forecast for the global marketplace channels.
Analyze data from multiple marketplace platforms, not limited to Amazon’s vendor central portal.
Provide feedback to the sales and operations process, including item level forecast detail for 5000+ items.
Review and provide insight and actions for KPI’s related to back orders and cut rates.
Analyze and report data outcomes to the supply chain leadership team
Support supply chain functions with ad-hoc reporting requests
Provide insight and recommendations for process optimization
Identify data gaps and support the upload of data when needed
Collaborate with and support cross functional partners (commercial, finance) with reporting needs.
Performs other duties as assigned


 Job Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in supply chain or business related field.
4-6 years of forecasting and S&OP experience.
Intermediate to advanced Excel skills including formulas and pivot table creation/analysis
Ability to work with others from different functional areas and levels within and outside the organization.
Excellent organizational, decision making and analytical skills
Strong math skills with an understanding of statistics
Knowledge of process improvement tools and techniques (lean, 6-sigma etc.)
Proficiency is Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams
Experience working in PowerBI and/or other large database tools with experience building complex data structure modeling
Knowledge of and/or experience in a Distribution/Logistics environment


 Benefits

Our benefits include healthcare; insurance benefits; retirement programs; paid time off plans; family and parenting leaves; wellness programs; discount purchase programs.
This is a full-time position with a base salary range of $75,000 - $85,000 plus benefits.

Seeking a Dynamic Website Performance Analyst to Drive Client Success!
Are you passionate about analyzing digital marketing data to drive performance improvements? As a Website Performance Analyst, you'll play a key role in optimizing our clients' digital presence across websites, eCommerce, and paid media channels. You will be responsible for reviewing and analyzing performance data, creating dashboards, and delivering actionable insights that enhance user interactions and drive business success. Working closely with our marketing, media, development, SEO, search, and data analyst teams, you'll leverage your expertise in data analysis and optimization to provide strategic recommendations and support data-driven decisions.
 Let us introduce ourselves:
Introducing The Brandon Agency: Fully integrated. Digital first. Data driven. As the largest independent agency in the Carolinas built for today's digital world, we offer in-house solutions from brand strategy to world-class video and content production, e-commerce infrastructure, full-stack website capabilities, social media management, public relations, and full-service paid media. Specializing in diverse categories including CPG, B2B, Financial, Healthcare, Utilities, Telcom, Real Estate, Lifestyle Apparel, Outdoor Leisure, and Resort Travel, we've earned recognition as one of the most creatively awarded agencies in the Carolinas, with accolades including features in prestigious awards such as the Nationals Addys, Emmys, Graphis, and more. We've been recognized as a "Best Place to Work" for seven consecutive years, fostering a culture of creativity and excellence, and empowering our team members to excel and innovate. Join us and be part of a passionate team dedicated to making a lasting impact in the marketing industry.
Become part of a team that values:

Fostering strong client connections
Delivering exceptional service
Creative and solution-oriented thinking
Shared commitment to client success

 What you'll do as Website Performance Analyst:
 Performance Monitoring and Analysis:

Track and analyze online performance metrics, including but not limited to page load times, bounce rates, traffic sources, and user behavior.
Utilize analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Excel, Looker Data Studio, Google Data Studio, SEO tools, etc. to generate data.

 Reporting and Insights:

Generate regular performance reports and present findings to internal teams and clients.
Provide actionable insights and recommendations to improve online performance and user experience.

 Optimization:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including web developers, designers, content creators, SEO and search specialists, to implement data-driven strategies that enhance online speed, usability, and overall performance.
Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to identify the most effective strategies for optimization.
Evaluate content performance, including page views, click-through rates, bounce rates, and conversion rates, and make recommendations for content optimization.

 SEO and SEM Support:

Assist in optimizing websites for search engines to improve organic search rankings.
Support paid search campaigns by providing performance data and insights.

 Client Communication:

Assist with new business proposals by providing analytics insights as needed.
Audit and analyze analytics accounts of potential new clients to assess needs and opportunities.
Engage in limited client communication when necessary.

 Knowledge and skills required for the position are:

Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Computer Science, Statistics, Information Science or a related field.
3+ years proven experience as a Website Performance Analyst or similar role in a digital marketing or advertising agency.
Experience with marketing analytics tools and techniques, including interactive analytics, social media analytics, marketing automation, and CRM tools
Strong understanding of SEO, SEM, and digital marketing principles.
Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail.
Proven ability to interpret data and develop actionable insights
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Experience with A/B testing and other optimization techniques.
Advanced knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager
Advanced experience with one or more of the following tools: Google Data Studio, Power BI, Datorama, Tableau, or other equivalent reporting platforms
Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and web development principles is a plus.

Do you possess the skills and experience to excel in this dynamic role? The Brandon Agency offers a competitive benefits package, including top-tier insurance, flexible PTO, and a 401k match. Join a team that values innovation, collaboration, and making a real impact. Apply Now!

Support a Lab environment

 DESIRED SKILLS

Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.

 Who We Are… 
When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what’s next…

From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

Your New Role...
The Growth Data Analyst is an important role in enabling the team to deliver data and insights requirements to key stakeholders across the business, including Marketing, Product, Research, Sales, TMG, Programming, and EDS. The role is responsible for understanding the TNT Sports’ data and analytics ecosystem and helping to create meaningful data solutions to advance stakeholders’ business objectives.

Role Accountabilities...

Gain an understanding of TNT Sports’ data and analytics needs to identify new opportunities to enhance data for business insights and marketing activations.
Translate business requirements into technical requirements through stakeholder interviews, data discovery, and exploratory and in-depth data analyses.
Work closely with Project Manager, Data Architect, and other members of the team, to determine feasibility and design, validate data sets, and ensure successful deliverables to stakeholders.
Wrangle data from multiple sources to create integrated and actionable data insights through data extraction and/or transformation processes via any data handling means relevant (SQL, Python, LookML, etc.).
Build and maintain relationships with matrixed teams across the organization.


Expected to be self-motivated, proactive and solution oriented.


Qualifications & Experience...
3+ years of experience as a business or data analyst in a fast-paced environment.
Strong data analysis, problem solving, time management, and communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills, including interpreting technical jargon to non-technical business users.
Advanced communication skills and analytic thinking with the ability to seamlessly communicate between technical and non-technical teams. Experience in technical documentation and data/process flows a plus.
Ability to work across various business groups and manage multiple projects with varying timelines.
Able to adapt and find creative solutions when faced with frequently changing and sometimes ambiguous goals. Excellent time management skills.
Ability to wrangle data sets across multiple sources to provide meaningful data to business users.

Experience gathering and translating business requirements into technical requirements. Experience working with complex data sets, analyzing and UATing the data. Proficient skills in SQL/Python/R/etc., SQL data bases like PostgreSQL and Snowflake, and BI Tools like Looker and Tableau. Knowledge of data engineering/pipelines (Pentaho) a plus.

How We Get Things Done…

This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

 Championing Inclusion at WBD Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. About Us
United Utility takes pride in offering comprehensive and innovative solutions that drive power infrastructure investments across the United States. As the parent company to industry-leading utility service contractors specializing in transmission, substation, distribution, and grid hardening projects, we are at the forefront of shaping the future of energy systems. Headquartered in the vibrant city of New Orleans, LA, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment that thrives on collaboration and innovation.
About The Role
The Cost Analyst is responsible for conducting financial analysis related to the costs of business activities. This includes analyzing data to determine cost structures, identifying cost reduction opportunities, preparing financial reports, and assisting management in decision-making to enhance profitability and efficiency. This is a hybrid role, requiring 2 office days per week (Wednesday and one day of your choice). Temporary location in Berlin, CT and relocation expected by 12/31/2024 to Hartford, CT.

Key Responsibilities


Cost Analysis:


Analyze financial data to determine the cost of business activities, such as manufacturing processes, labor, and materials.
Assist with cost/budget and invoice control for the project.
Develop cost estimates for new and existing products, projects, or services.
Monitor and analyze actual costs compared to budgeted costs and explain variances.


Financial Reporting:


Prepare detailed financial reports and summaries for management, highlighting cost trends, potential savings, and financial impacts.
Assist in the preparation of annual budgets, forecasts, and financial planning.


Cost Control & Management:


Evaluate existing cost control procedures and recommend improvements.
Collaborate with various departments to implement cost-saving initiatives and monitor their effectiveness.
Review and analyze inventory valuations, manufacturing costs, and project costs.


Data Analysis & Research:


Collect, compile, and analyze data to assess the financial implications of business decisions.
Research and analyze market trends, operational costs, and pricing strategies.


Process Improvement:


Identify inefficiencies in operations and recommend process improvements to optimize cost management.
Participate in cross-functional teams to drive cost-saving projects.


Compliance & Risk Management:


Ensure compliance with internal financial policies and procedures.
Assess potential financial risks and provide recommendations to mitigate them.



Key Qualifications

Education: Bachelor’s degree in finance, Accounting, Economics, Business Administration, or a related field.
Experience: 2-5 years of experience in cost analysis, financial analysis, or a related field.
Skills:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in financial modeling and data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, ERP systems, and financial software).
Attention to detail and high level of accuracy.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.



Key Info

In this role, you'll find yourself engaging in a variety of tasks that contribute to our financial success. While performing your duties, you'll regularly sit for extended periods, utilizing fine motor skills for tasks such as keyboard use and writing. Additionally, you'll have the opportunity to stand, walk, and engage in physical movement as needed.
At United Utility, we embrace diversity and believe in the power of an inclusive workforce. We encourage all qualified candidates, regardless of background, to apply. Join us in shaping the future of energy infrastructure and making a meaningful impact on the world. Apply today and be a part of something transformative.
To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter to [application email address]. We look forward to hearing from you!

Description  JOB SUMMARY 
 
The Clinical Research Data Analyst hold data management and regulatory responsibilities relevant to Clinical Research. Data management refers to the day to day collection of data from patient medical records for submission to clinical study sponsors with minimal errors. In the event of identified errors, Clinical Research Data Analyst will oversee corrections. The position is also responsible for the collection and maintenance of federal regulatory documentation required for all Clinical Research studies and for submission to the IRB of record for the clinical study. Both responsibilities require the communication with research staff, Physician-investigators, study sponsors, and clinical offices internal and external to the organization. The Clinical Research Data Analyst is to ensure that department is compliant with policies and procedures affecting regulatory documents, review, approval, activation, regulation; along with the tracking and reporting of protocols; ensure appropriate processing and maintenance of all study related documents; and assist in the development of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and to assist the efforts of the department's day to day operation. The Clinical Research Data Analyst will perform all other related duties as assigned.
GENERAL REQUIREMENTS 
 
Adheres to the hospital and departmental attendance and punctuality guidelines
Performs all job responsibilities in alignment with the core values, mission and vision of the organization
Performs other duties as required and completes all job functions as per departmental policies and procedures

About the company 


Albertsons Companies is at the forefront of the revolution in retail. With a fixation on raising the bar with innovation and building belonging through our culture, our team is rallying our company around a unique purpose : to create joy around each table and inspire a healthier tomorrow for every community. 


Albertsons Companies is one of the largest food and drug retailers in the United States, with over 2,200 stores in 34 states and the District of Columbia. Our well-known banners include Albertsons, Safeway, Vons, Jewel-Osco, Shaw's, Acme, Tom Thumb, Randalls, United Supermarkets, Pavilions, Star Market, Haggen, Carrs, Kings Food Markets, and Balducci's Food Lovers Market. We support our stores with 22 distribution centers and 19 manufacturing plants.



Bring your flavor 


Building the future of food and well-being starts with you. Join our team and bring your best self to the table.


#bringyourflavor


#LI-JM2


What you will be doing 


Position Purpose:  The purpose of this position is to be involved with the assignment of complex reverse logistics processes crucial to the organizations ability to service our customers and manage returns and reclamation of unsaleable goods.  Key Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: 



Ensure data integrity of reclamation item attributes within Inventory Management System.




Provide support for unsaleable vendor billing and corresponding store credits processing.




Develop primary responsibility for the PRC period close process - data retrieval, application of business rules, reporting.




Assist in management of hazardous waste data integrity.




Analyze and report impact of vendor reclamation/swell policies for the category management teams.




Manage large sets of data from several different sources.




Prioritize and respond to requests from stores and vendors to group email.




Work with Division Shrink Managers and Receiving coordinators.




Will assist in determining vendor paybacks and adjustments.




Reconcile invoice discrepancies.




Research store inventory adjustments on a regular basis.




Work with Category Management on vendor compliance and policy issues.




Execute PRC initiatives.




Analyze, interpret and provide insight/conclusions relating to PRC tasks.




Perform root cause analysis and reporting to internal and external groups.



   Support Retail Operations and retail stores.




The position will be based in Boise, Idaho.





What we are searching for 
Qualifications: 



Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience




Proficient computer skills including Microsoft Word, Excel, and Power Point




Must be proficient in MS Access database manipulation, VB experience may be helpful




Strong experience in SQL




DB2 experience preferred with understanding of table constructs, index use, data types, db concepts, etc.




Experience with Google Cloud Platform preferred




Excellent analytical skills




High degree of initiative with strong planning skills; must be able to work independently and be a team player




Strong organizational skills with the ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously




Must be a self-starter




Excellent oral and written communication skills.



TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS: <10%

Our 290,000 associates have a passion for great service and building lasting relationships with our customers. Through a companywide focus on innovation, we are continually enhancing our digital and product offerings, making it easy for customers to get what they need, wherever they are.

Why Choose CHURCHILL DOWNS INC.
 Headquartered in Louisville, Kentucky, Churchill Downs Incorporated has expanded through the development of live and historical racing entertainment venues, the growth of the TwinSpires horse racing online wagering business and the operation and development of regional casino gaming properties. Churchill Downs Incorporated is an inclusive and fun place to work. We celebrate unique approaches and points of view. We believe diversity is a mindset that drives excellence. The Regional Database Marketing Analyst is responsible for the execution of direct marketing programs for a collection of gaming properties in the portfolio. This role involves segmenting customer databases, creating targeted offers within the source system, and deploying marketing emails to maximize customer engagement and drive revenue. The ideal candidate possesses strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and a deep understanding of customer segmentation strategies in the gaming industry.
 What's in it for you:

401K plan with company matching
Employee Stock Purchase Program
Health, dental, and vision insurance
FSA and HSA with company contribution to HSA
Tuition reimbursement and tuition discounts
Be part of a growing and exciting industry!
Professional development

Some of what you'll do in this role:

Customer Data Management:

Extract relevant customer data from various sources and consolidate it for marketing purposes.
Segment customer lists based on demographics, gaming behavior, and other relevant criteria.

Campaign Planning and Strategy:

Collaborate with marketing team members to develop targeted campaign strategies.
Analyze past campaign and customer data to identify opportunities for optimization.
Assist in the development of marketing offers and promotions tailored to specific customer segments.

Offer Creation and Implementation:

Utilize the casino's source system to create customized offers and incentives for targeted customer segments.
Work closely with the analytics team to ensure offers are data-driven and aligned with business objectives.
Coordinate with relevant departments to ensure seamless implementation of marketing offers across various channels.

Email Marketing Deployment:

Design and execute email marketing campaigns using industry-standard tools and platforms.
Develop compelling email content, subject lines, and calls-to-action to drive customer engagement.
Monitor email deliverability, open rates, click-through rates, and other key performance metrics.
Performance Tracking and Reporting:
Track and analyze the effectiveness of marketing campaigns in driving customer engagement and revenue.


What you need for this role:

Ability to effectively gather and analyze data to leverage in process management.
Ability to analyze and interpret department needs and results to solve complex problems.
Excellent customer service, oral, and written communication skills.
Availability to work when needed, including weekends, nights, and holidays.
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or related field required, or relevant work experience in database marketing and data analysis, with background in querying, utilizing multiple databases and business intelligence/reporting tools to manage data and reports.
Proficiency in Excel and Access required; experience with SQL strongly preferred.
Able to obtain and maintain a valid gaming license for each of the CDI HRM and/or casino gaming jurisdictions where we operate.

 Job Summary
HathiTrust Digital Library is a partnership of academic and research institutions offering a collection of 18+ million titles digitized from libraries around the world. We are administratively based at the University of Michigan Library and our staff are employees of the University.
We are looking for a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst who has experience organizing and analyzing data for service improvement and organizational decision-making, and an interest in applying their skills to our mission of making accessible the record of human knowledge.
You will be a member of a new team focused on business process, business intelligence, and project management, and, along with the team, you will help bring about organizational change and support HathiTrust's Strategic Vision. You will fill a new role to become our first business intelligence analyst, working collaboratively to develop an assessment program that will position HathiTrust to monitor and evaluate our performance and impact, demonstrate our value, and use assessment to drive decision-making for future work. You will work alongside the Senior Project Manager and you will report to the Business Process Consultant Lead, who provides overall leadership for the team and guides the development of program strategy for business assessment and workflow design, portfolio and project management, and service road mapping and design.
 Why Work at Michigan?
The University of Michigan offers a comprehensive benefits package including:

Health, dental, and vision insurance.
Generous time off (24 vacation days per year, and 15 sick days per year).
A retirement plan that provides two-for-one matching contributions with immediate vesting.
Professional development opportunities, including support for ongoing training and certification.
Flexible spending accounts for healthcare and dependent care expenses.
Life insurance, long-term disability coverage, and more.

 Responsibilities*

Develop a thorough understanding of HathiTrust's data ecosystem, including learning about current tools used and collaborating with HathiTrust staff and members to understand their data needs, and infuse that understanding into your work.
Guide the identification, organization, and analysis of service-specific metrics for monitoring and evaluation.
Develop a robust and integrated assessment program to be implemented on a continuous basis, pulling service-specific metrics together into an organizational context to evaluate impact, demonstrate our value, drive decision making, and tell our story.
Identify, implement, and manage processes and tools for data collection, reporting, and analysis of key metrics.
Guide the development and implementation of data policies, such as data privacy and retention policies, in partnership with the Enterprise Architect and other Team Leads.
Lead projects related to data collection and analysis, and support projects led by others as needed.
Understand diverse perspectives and promote the use of best practices to foster an inclusive climate that encourages and affirms all individuals.

 Required Qualifications*

Bachelor's degree or higher, or equivalent combination of education, certification, and experience.
5+ years of experience with the following:
     
Analytical programs/projects focused on outcomes/impact assessment, service improvement, and/or business intelligence.
Analyzing large data sets, i.e. data sets with millions of data points, in environments such as R, Python, and SAS/SPSS.
Query design, report writing, and data visualization, using tools such as Tableau and Power BI, etc.
Knowledge of database structures and data architecture relevant to the development of dynamic reporting, including experience with SQL.

Experience implementing new practices to bring about positive organizational change, and report complex findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
An understanding of the value of diversity and the importance of inclusion expressed through a commitment to apply and incorporate the differences, complexities, and opportunities that diversity brings to an organization.

 Modes of Work
On-site, hybrid, and remote options are available for this position.
Positions that are eligible for hybrid or mobile/remote work mode are at the discretion of the hiring department. Work agreements are reviewed annually at a minimum and are subject to change at any time, and for any reason, throughout the course of employment. Learn more about the work modes.
 Additional Information
We have been thoughtful about the required qualifications listed in this posting to provide a framework for the core skills and competencies that are needed for success in this role. We also recognize that talent and expertise come from a variety of experiences and value the unique perspectives each individual may have gained along their career journey. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment and encourage applicants who can demonstrate, through the application and interview process, that their skills are aligned to the role's needs. We assess all qualified candidates based on their arrival point, not the path they took to get here. More information on the University of Michigan Library's Diversity Plan can be found here.
Your contributions in this role are essential to meeting the goals of HathiTrust's Building Resilience for Access and Preservation grant, a multi-year effort to strengthen our preservation and access mission.
 Application Deadline
Job openings are posted for a minimum of seven calendar days. The review and selection process may begin as early as the eighth day after posting. This opening may be removed from posting boards and filled anytime after the minimum posting period has ended.

About the Role:
When you join the HUB team, you become part of an entrepreneurial team of talented people. This gratifying role focuses on discovering missing commission revenue. Following the clues, researching discrepancies and solving the puzzle to collect revenue due keeps this opportunity fresh and exciting. As a liaison between operations and accounting, this position directly impacts regional revenue, producer compensation and accuracy in financial reporting. Daily interaction with all levels of personnel and outside insurance carriers is vital to this role. Hub’s rapid and continuing growth keeps this work fast paced and creates future opportunities in the Finance Department. Successful candidate is a self-starter, highly organized, and detail oriented.

 What You’ll Do:

Liaison between operations personnel and local, regional, and corporate accounting to ensure correct posting of revenue.
Utilize business management and document management systems to obtain needed supporting documents.
Generate reports and consolidate data into designated Excel template file.
Analyze data and research variances indicating missing revenue.
Communicate with internal servicers and outside carrier representatives to determine issues and status of payment.
Resolve producer commission inquiries.
Work in conjunction with Hub Financial Center (HFC) and Accounting Resource Center (ARC) to resolve posting issues.
Other duties as occasionally requested by regional finance, HFC and ARC.
Effectiveness and incentives measured by revenue recovered and successful completion of assigned tasks


 Qualifications & Experience to be Successful:

Strong Excel skills required
Excellent written and verbal communication skills required
Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks
Super initiative and problem-solving capability
Experience with BenefitPoint, Epic, ImageRight and Microsoft Office preferred

Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.

 Who We Are… 
When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what’s next…

From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

Your New Role...
The Growth Data Analyst is an important role in enabling the team to deliver data and insights requirements to key stakeholders across the business, including Marketing, Product, Research, Sales, TMG, Programming, and EDS. The role is responsible for understanding the TNT Sports’ data and analytics ecosystem and helping to create meaningful data solutions to advance stakeholders’ business objectives.

Role Accountabilities...

Gain an understanding of TNT Sports’ data and analytics needs to identify new opportunities to enhance data for business insights and marketing activations.
Translate business requirements into technical requirements through stakeholder interviews, data discovery, and exploratory and in-depth data analyses.
Work closely with Project Manager, Data Architect, and other members of the team, to determine feasibility and design, validate data sets, and ensure successful deliverables to stakeholders.
Wrangle data from multiple sources to create integrated and actionable data insights through data extraction and/or transformation processes via any data handling means relevant (SQL, Python, LookML, etc.).
Build and maintain relationships with matrixed teams across the organization.


Expected to be self-motivated, proactive and solution oriented.


Qualifications & Experience...
3+ years of experience as a business or data analyst in a fast-paced environment.
Strong data analysis, problem solving, time management, and communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills, including interpreting technical jargon to non-technical business users.
Advanced communication skills and analytic thinking with the ability to seamlessly communicate between technical and non-technical teams. Experience in technical documentation and data/process flows a plus.
Ability to work across various business groups and manage multiple projects with varying timelines.
Able to adapt and find creative solutions when faced with frequently changing and sometimes ambiguous goals. Excellent time management skills.
Ability to wrangle data sets across multiple sources to provide meaningful data to business users.

Experience gathering and translating business requirements into technical requirements. Experience working with complex data sets, analyzing and UATing the data. Proficient skills in SQL/Python/R/etc., SQL data bases like PostgreSQL and Snowflake, and BI Tools like Looker and Tableau. Knowledge of data engineering/pipelines (Pentaho) a plus.

How We Get Things Done…

This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

 Overview: 
 
  Future Technologies is in search of a Data Link Analyst to join our winning team. FTI is a proven, employee-focused provider of mission-critical information systems and technical support services to government and private sector organizations worldwide. Our professional team combines the technical depth, breadth and experience of a large firm with the agility, efficiency and personal service that only a smaller firm can offer.
  Responsibilities: 
 
Identify interoperability requirements and testing methodologies to ensure all M&S tools maintain interoperability standards and the ability to coordinate and direct large scale testing and data analysis efforts during both real time events and post event data analysis events.
Conduct advanced tactical data link engineering, analysis and simulation systems operations.
Support all aspects of testing Naval tactical systems and tactical data link (TDL) capabilities of C4ISR and weapon systems, to include AEGIS, FMS and LCS interfaces, Link 16, Link 11, multilink data forwarding, and JREAP-A & C.
Planning for test events; Developing mission oriented and standards conformance test procedures based on the format and transactional requirements in applicable military standards
Operating simulators, link monitoring systems, and other test tools
Directing and/or supporting test conduct; Performing real-time and post-test analysis; develop and maintain scenarios and scripts for Simulation Systems and documenting test results.
 Qualifications: 
 
High School diploma with 4 years relevant work experience or an Associate’s Degree with 1 years relevant work experience; or 4 years relevant work experience.
Proficient with Microsoft Office applications (Word/Excel)
Knowledge of tactical data link operations
Four (4) years of operational experience in a real-world setting
Support a Lab environment
Provide support to user community by responding to requests for technical assistance
Active Secret security clearance

 DESIRED SKILLS

Knowledge of the NAVY combat system

 Job Summary
HathiTrust Digital Library is a partnership of academic and research institutions offering a collection of 18+ million titles digitized from libraries around the world. We are administratively based at the University of Michigan Library and our staff are employees of the University.
We are looking for a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst who has experience organizing and analyzing data for service improvement and organizational decision-making, and an interest in applying their skills to our mission of making accessible the record of human knowledge.
You will be a member of a new team focused on business process, business intelligence, and project management, and, along with the team, you will help bring about organizational change and support HathiTrust's Strategic Vision. You will fill a new role to become our first business intelligence analyst, working collaboratively to develop an assessment program that will position HathiTrust to monitor and evaluate our performance and impact, demonstrate our value, and use assessment to drive decision-making for future work. You will work alongside the Senior Project Manager and you will report to the Business Process Consultant Lead, who provides overall leadership for the team and guides the development of program strategy for business assessment and workflow design, portfolio and project management, and service road mapping and design.
 Why Work at Michigan?
The University of Michigan offers a comprehensive benefits package including:

Health, dental, and vision insurance.
Generous time off (24 vacation days per year, and 15 sick days per year).
A retirement plan that provides two-for-one matching contributions with immediate vesting.
Professional development opportunities, including support for ongoing training and certification.
Flexible spending accounts for healthcare and dependent care expenses.
Life insurance, long-term disability coverage, and more.

 Responsibilities*

Develop a thorough understanding of HathiTrust's data ecosystem, including learning about current tools used and collaborating with HathiTrust staff and members to understand their data needs, and infuse that understanding into your work.
Guide the identification, organization, and analysis of service-specific metrics for monitoring and evaluation.
Develop a robust and integrated assessment program to be implemented on a continuous basis, pulling service-specific metrics together into an organizational context to evaluate impact, demonstrate our value, drive decision making, and tell our story.
Identify, implement, and manage processes and tools for data collection, reporting, and analysis of key metrics.
Guide the development and implementation of data policies, such as data privacy and retention policies, in partnership with the Enterprise Architect and other Team Leads.
Lead projects related to data collection and analysis, and support projects led by others as needed.
Understand diverse perspectives and promote the use of best practices to foster an inclusive climate that encourages and affirms all individuals.

 Required Qualifications*

Bachelor's degree or higher, or equivalent combination of education, certification, and experience.
5+ years of experience with the following:
     
Analytical programs/projects focused on outcomes/impact assessment, service improvement, and/or business intelligence.
Analyzing large data sets, i.e. data sets with millions of data points, in environments such as R, Python, and SAS/SPSS.
Query design, report writing, and data visualization, using tools such as Tableau and Power BI, etc.
Knowledge of database structures and data architecture relevant to the development of dynamic reporting, including experience with SQL.

Experience implementing new practices to bring about positive organizational change, and report complex findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
An understanding of the value of diversity and the importance of inclusion expressed through a commitment to apply and incorporate the differences, complexities, and opportunities that diversity brings to an organization.

 Modes of Work
On-site, hybrid, and remote options are available for this position.
Positions that are eligible for hybrid or mobile/remote work mode are at the discretion of the hiring department. Work agreements are reviewed annually at a minimum and are subject to change at any time, and for any reason, throughout the course of employment. Learn more about the work modes.
 Additional Information
We have been thoughtful about the required qualifications listed in this posting to provide a framework for the core skills and competencies that are needed for success in this role. We also recognize that talent and expertise come from a variety of experiences and value the unique perspectives each individual may have gained along their career journey. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment and encourage applicants who can demonstrate, through the application and interview process, that their skills are aligned to the role's needs. We assess all qualified candidates based on their arrival point, not the path they took to get here. More information on the University of Michigan Library's Diversity Plan can be found here.
Your contributions in this role are essential to meeting the goals of HathiTrust's Building Resilience for Access and Preservation grant, a multi-year effort to strengthen our preservation and access mission.
 Application Deadline
Job openings are posted for a minimum of seven calendar days. The review and selection process may begin as early as the eighth day after posting. This opening may be removed from posting boards and filled anytime after the minimum posting period has ended.

About The Role
The Cost Analyst is responsible for conducting financial analysis related to the costs of business activities. This includes analyzing data to determine cost structures, identifying cost reduction opportunities, preparing financial reports, and assisting management in decision-making to enhance profitability and efficiency. This is a hybrid role, requiring 2 office days per week (Wednesday and one day of your choice). Temporary location in Berlin, CT and relocation expected by 12/31/2024 to Hartford, CT.

Key Responsibilities


Cost Analysis:


Analyze financial data to determine the cost of business activities, such as manufacturing processes, labor, and materials.
Assist with cost/budget and invoice control for the project.
Develop cost estimates for new and existing products, projects, or services.
Monitor and analyze actual costs compared to budgeted costs and explain variances.


Financial Reporting:


Prepare detailed financial reports and summaries for management, highlighting cost trends, potential savings, and financial impacts.
Assist in the preparation of annual budgets, forecasts, and financial planning.


Cost Control & Management:


Evaluate existing cost control procedures and recommend improvements.
Collaborate with various departments to implement cost-saving initiatives and monitor their effectiveness.
Review and analyze inventory valuations, manufacturing costs, and project costs.


Data Analysis & Research:


Collect, compile, and analyze data to assess the financial implications of business decisions.
Research and analyze market trends, operational costs, and pricing strategies.


Process Improvement:


Identify inefficiencies in operations and recommend process improvements to optimize cost management.
Participate in cross-functional teams to drive cost-saving projects.


Compliance & Risk Management:


Ensure compliance with internal financial policies and procedures.
Assess potential financial risks and provide recommendations to mitigate them.



Key Qualifications

Education: Bachelor’s degree in finance, Accounting, Economics, Business Administration, or a related field.
Experience: 2-5 years of experience in cost analysis, financial analysis, or a related field.
Skills:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in financial modeling and data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, ERP systems, and financial software).
Attention to detail and high level of accuracy.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.



Key Info

In this role, you'll find yourself engaging in a variety of tasks that contribute to our financial success. While performing your duties, you'll regularly sit for extended periods, utilizing fine motor skills for tasks such as keyboard use and writing. Additionally, you'll have the opportunity to stand, walk, and engage in physical movement as needed.
At United Utility, we embrace diversity and believe in the power of an inclusive workforce. We encourage all qualified candidates, regardless of background, to apply. Join us in shaping the future of energy infrastructure and making a meaningful impact on the world. Apply today and be a part of something transformative.

Description  JOB SUMMARY 
 
The Clinical Research Data Analyst hold data management and regulatory responsibilities relevant to Clinical Research. Data management refers to the day to day collection of data from patient medical records for submission to clinical study sponsors with minimal errors. In the event of identified errors, Clinical Research Data Analyst will oversee corrections. The position is also responsible for the collection and maintenance of federal regulatory documentation required for all Clinical Research studies and for submission to the IRB of record for the clinical study. Both responsibilities require the communication with research staff, Physician-investigators, study sponsors, and clinical offices internal and external to the organization. The Clinical Research Data Analyst is to ensure that department is compliant with policies and procedures affecting regulatory documents, review, approval, activation, regulation; along with the tracking and reporting of protocols; ensure appropriate processing and maintenance of all study related documents; and assist in the development of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and to assist the efforts of the department's day to day operation. The Clinical Research Data Analyst will perform all other related duties as assigned.
GENERAL REQUIREMENTS 
 
Adheres to the hospital and departmental attendance and punctuality guidelines
Performs all job responsibilities in alignment with the core values, mission and vision of the organization
Performs other duties as required and completes all job functions as per departmental policies and procedures
Maintains current knowledge in present areas of responsibility (i.e., self education, attends ongoing educational programs)
Attends staff meetings and completes mandatory in-services and requirements and competency evaluations on time.
Demonstrates competency at all levels in providing care to all patients based on age, sex, weight, and demonstrated needs. For non-clinical areas, has attended training and demonstrates usage of age- specific customer service skills.
Background in medical technology.
WORKING CONDITIONS 
 
General environment: Works in a well-lighted, air-conditioned area, with moderate noise levels.
May be required to change from one task to another of different nature without loss of efficiency or composure.
Periods of high stress and fluctuating workloads may occur.May be scheduled as needed including overtime
   Qualifications  EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS 
 
4 year / Bachelor's Degree (Required)
Master's Degree (Preferred)
EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS 
 
2 year data collection and/or federal documentation or related experience (Required)
CERTIFICATIONS AND LICENSURES 
 
Certified Clinical Research Professional (CCRP-SoCRA) or Clinical Research Associates (CRA) obtained within 3 years of hire (Required)
GENERAL SKILLS 
 
Organizational Skills
Communication Skills
Interpersonal Skills
Customer Relations
Analytical
Read / Comprehend Written Instructions
Follow Verbal Instructions
Transcription
Basic Computer Skills
Microsoft Office Suite
General Clerical Skills

Ability to perform - repetitive tasks/motion

  Hyster-Yale Materials Handling, Inc, a world-class manufacturer of industrial lift trucks, has an outstanding opportunity for an exceptional and talented Inventory Integrity Analyst I-II (on-site) based at our Berea, KY location.

The City of Caldwell Police Department is seeking a Crime Data Analyst to join our ranks!

Performs tactical, strategic, and administrative analysis of crimes, locations, calls for service, and suspects within the City of Caldwell jurisdiction. Uses complex relational databases, highly secure law enforcement computer application and geographic information systems (GIS) to conduct statistical analysis, detect and analyze crime series/patterns, forecast crime trends, and identify suspect/crime/victim relationships to organize, disseminate and preset finding to the appropriate unit(s) for response. Work requires initiative and independent judgement and is performed under general supervision.

 Education, Training and/or Experience Required:

Good knowledge and at least 2 years' experience working with data analytics, statistics and preparing related reports
Good knowledge of research techniques and data manipulation using a database, query language, word processing, desktop publishing, spreadsheets, GIS and internet/intranet resources.
Good knowledge of crime/intelligence analysis processes, including the relationship among law enforcement, courts, and corrections at the local, state, and federal level.
Experience authoring SQL queries to extract data from multiple sources.
Good knowledge of analysis processes, types, functions, and assessments; classification restrictions, laws, and procedures pertaining to sensitive and confidential information.

Preferred:

Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Criminal Justice, Political Science, or Public Administration

 Licenses, Certifications and Other Requirements:

Successful completion of pre-employment polygraph, background check, including Criminal Justice Information System (CJIS) and reference checks


 Benefits: The City of Caldwell has Exceptional benefits for full time officers include longevity pay, certificate pay for intermediate and advanced POST certificates, paid time off, 10 paid holidays, medical, vision, dental, life insurance, PERSI retirement with 401(k) employer match of up to 2%, 457 retirement plan, and HRA VEBA post-retirement account and more!
